campaign.story:
play [white label] on steam!
TWITTER | DISCORD | TRY OUT ARCADE MIX

BRAND NEW STRETCH GOALS TIME!
oh boy
FOR $200,000 (TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS), WE'RE ADDING REMIXES AND ACOUSTIC VERSIONS. 
All of which will be playable! We've already started experimenting with a few of these; and they're turning out VERY good; we featured a lil bit of Empty Diary's acoustic mix way back in our 2020 trailer, and already have some stuff on the way for Mirror and Forever Now. You can expect way more of it in the final game with this goal met.
FOR $300,000 (THREE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS), WE'RE ADDING ONLINE MULTIPLAYER. 
While we want to just go, hey, mic drop, no explanation needed, here is some explanation: 
you will be able to queue in online lobbies and try and get a better score than your friend or enemy, at the same time as them
you can use custom beatmap tracks, provided that you and your friend or enemy also has said beatmap tracks
all of the community features will be linked into it
it might be post-launch, but it will be added
NETCODE IS HARD. We already said that. But if we hit this goal, we can absolutely promise this much. We want to do more, but without a lot more funding and a lot of beta-testing, I am legally unable to tell you any other multiplayer features the game may or may not have. Also hey, let's say it again:
netcode is hard
Anyway, what's up? Feeling okay?
YOU, THE PERSON READING THIS: Hold on wait HOW DID YOU GET FUNDED IN A DAY?
D-CELL GAMES, EXCEPT PERSONIFIED AS A SINGLE ENTITY: We have no idea! People like this thing! Go figure.
YOU:  I'm figuring! Also, what's with...the format? 
 D: It's just a conceit. I'm meant to represent us, the people who made this dang thing. You represent, well, you, but you're not you, because you're not actually having these thoughts. I mean, it'd be cool if you did. Did you? That would freak me out a bit, if that was me. ANYWAY HERE'S THE GAME:
unbeatable is a videogame
Y: This tells me nothing. 
D: It tells you tons of things! Look, right there. It says "unbeatable is a video game" in casual lowercase. You can see it right there! Levels! Story! Other!
Y: Why’d you make it look like a Dreamcast game? 
D: I already regret doing the interview gimmick. You know what, forget it. Let's start from the top! Again!
Y: Wait, hold on, what are-
It's a narratively-hyperfocused dense exploration game where two-button rhythm combat powers more or less everything.
EXPLORE AND HELP PEOPLE(?)
One half is this: you explore the game world, meeting terrible people and building a setlist for your upcoming concerts. Helping strangers, practicing with bandmates, sleeping in all day - it's your funeral, you'll only have so many days before each big event!
"street-style taiko" is what someone has called this, and we're stealing it
The other half is this: arcade-flawless rhythm gameplay powered by an entirely original soundtrack. It's simple but frenetic - sure, there's only two buttons, but there's a lot of visual variety to the setpiece-styled battles. Want to groove exclusively to the rhythm gameplay? We'll have an ARCADE MODE available for you to play from the start!
The setup: In the world of UNBEATABLE, music has been outlawed For Reasons You'll Find Out.
The twist: A small girl has decided to bring it back. 
The punchline: Beat (that's you, you are her) finds herself tangled up in her plans...and in the crosshairs of both the police and a mysterious new enemy...
But enough talk. Want to give the game a shot? We're releasing UNBEATABLE [white label], our episodic side-story demo, on Steam now! SIDE A Track 1, which lets you play 12 songs and learn more about the vibrant world of UNBEATABLE!
Beat used to try to sing. Now she *sings*. Hopefully she'll be able to figure all of this out before things get worse.
Quaver's the young, smart, and the tenacious backbone of the band. Even at her lowest moments, you can't tell her to just give up. You couldn't pick a better guitarist for this band!
There's more to Treble than his lazy, sleepy attitude - as the keyboardist of the band, Treble's always reliable, even when he would rather be taking a nap.
In contrast to her twin brother, Clef is LOUD. Like, loud.
UNBEATABLE aims to look like a long lost bootleg 90s VHS recording of the newest anime on the block.
Our touchpoints for this project are numerous, probably way too many to count!  - but also admittedly reductive of what we're setting out to do. We want UNBEATABLE to stand as its own look in terms of art direction and give it a melancholic flair. We're doing more than just taking the classic anime look as our own!
Music is an important part of the game, although we're sure that's pretty obvious. You can listen to a preview of the game's soundtrack above. The music is written to accompany important narrative beats and motifs of the game's story, and there's also going to a bevy of B-SIDES (by RJ Lake) and story-exclusive tracks present in the final release.
I mean, or you could just...listen to it
PLAY

So you might be thinking, "oh god, I have to play a rhythm game? hard pass. i'd rather read the Iliad."  And we get it.  The Iliad rules.  But look: if you just wanted to play the game's story mode and vibe to the beat without being frustrated by the beat (or would like to/need to tweak settings to make the game more comfortable to play...or even just wanted to see if a difficulty is right for you?) We'll be implementing several accessibility options for the game, one of which will be the game's "Assist Mode".
The demo includes one feature from this mode called "AUTOPLAY", where Beat will automatically attack even if you provide mis-inputs (although if you do make a timed hit, it will take your accuracy into account). Let us know what you think on the feature, but do note that we will be looking into implementing (across the whole game):
Modifiers that disable health and adjust regen.
Options for color-blind users
Various options to configure dialogue visibility
Full controller / keyboard custom bindings
Screen-Shake Toggle (will be added eventually in [white label]
In addition, we currently have the following available in the [white label] demo:
Toggles for both the VHS Filter and Post-Processing
Controller Presets
Configurable Scrolling Speed for incoming enemy attacks
Configurable Game Offset (with an in-game wizard!)
Adjustable Game Speed ( 0.5x / 2x)
No-Fail Mode
So, I'm interested...but...who are you?
I'm glad you asked! Say hi to us:

UNBEATABLE IS A VIDEO GAME WHICH IS BEING... 
ANDREW TSAI (@PixelHavokk) loves anime, and will be tried in court over it. He came up with the initial concept for UNBEATABLE fairly soon after making a game where you have to type to stay alive, and then told Jeff about it, and then they told other people, and hey, now you know. He does the art direction, most of the animation, works on some of the code, has a "story by" credit, and handles combat design and polish. Lots of hats! More hats than a person usually has space for on their head. He's the reason most of the characters have music names. 
RJ LAKE (@spellbang) has been sort of accidentally-ing his way through the games industry for almost a decade now, bouncing between asset creation, design, biz dev, and Other. Used to work on Homestuck* (listen to volume ten!) and does stuff with Strange Scaffold (dog airport!). Does Not Code, And Is Sorry. He's handling music direction, additional music, narrative design, dialogue, some setpiece design, all the storyboarding Andrew doesn't do, and is in charge of most of the marketing (the trailer was his fault). He's to blame for all the jokes. 

TJ Maddux (@respinmusic)is D-CELL's resident composer and musician. His musical journey started by playing drums for rock bands that regularly pushed sound pressure levels far past safe listening limits, but he eventually waned on the aggressive use of volume in order to  study the sorcery that is jazz composition. He's responsible for the live recording that drives UNBEATABLE.
Jack of all cables, mastering of songs; Vasily Nikolaev (@VastonikMusic) makes it his goal to immerse yourself in worlds that sound real, but feel stylish. Music composer and SFX artist, he handles mixing of all the songs in the game and is responsible for most of the synth work and wilder production tricks you'll hear, as well as a huge chunk of the sound design.
Together, TJ and Vas work as peak divide and provide the vast majority of the soundtrack for UNBEATABLE.
Mireille Arseneault (@ProgramGamer) is known for being the TIGsource forums admin and is the main programmer on UNBEATABLE. Mireille's role on UNBEATABLE is to implement the game's various systems. These allow the rest of the team to create dialogue, quests, and beatmaps!  They live in Canada, where bagged milk is.
Jeffrey Chiao (@comet_melting) is UNBEATABLE’s producer and beatmap designer and helps out RJ with biz dev stuff! They keep the team in check (by dousing the fiery equivalent of game production havoc) and build  the amazing beatmaps that accompany Peak Divide’s soundtrack. Outside of UNBEATABLE, they also work on several other games as the director of  SKY HOUR WORKS.
Rachel Lake (@rachelklake) is an illustrator and UNBEATABLE's lead vocalist (and the voice actor for Beat). She helps out with PR, community management, and additional art, and supports the team by derailing meetings with Minecraft memes.
IN ADDITION, we've got:
Moxie Riles (they/them) helping out D-CELL GAMES with UNBEATABLE as a cleanup artist (and cheerleader).
and Yumna Taqiyyah (@Taqibunn) is helping out with additional animation! You can see her work on the band up there!
We began development of UNBEATABLE in early 2018, going through a long pre-production phase lasting up until mid-2020; we took a long time locking down core gameplay and the game's final narrative. Since then, we've been working part-time on the full production of the game. It's come a long way since people have first gotten to play the game at MAGFest 2019!
Right now, we're developing the game's vertical slice (which covers the game's second chapter) - and with that almost completed (it's...close), we're looking to head straight to work on developing the rest of the story mode. We expect this is going to be at the minimum a two year effort, based on how long things have taken so far.
worse than text
IT'S TIME FOR PIE CHARTS WITH JEFF:
We are now switching over to Jeff! That's me. Lemme take you a quick rundown of the financials of this KS and the project. The charts really explain themselves, but let's break it down to everyone's favorite - the pie charts.
PIE CHART #1 - Our Kickstarter Breakdownnnnnnnnnnn
As for what our development breakdown looks like, here you go!
PIE CHARTS 2 - What all of our development costs are going into!
Up to this point, we've been running entirely with little to no funds making the game - so having a jumpstart of any kind would help guarantee the game the resources it needs to become a reality! It's no secret that the project will need a lot more than this - funding UNBEATABLE's base goal will help us develop the game's vertical slice and be able to pursue more funding, but the actual development costs for the final project are on estimate to be roughly ten-times our budget floor (games are expensive, guys).
Without funding, we still anticipate continue production on the game, but we won't be able to meet our 2023 release window. That's...just how...these things...go

*please don't hold that against us

Wanna upgrade the demo(s) with new content? Help us out with some exciting achievement goals!

Every Kickstarter apparently needs to say “every Kickstarter needs this” when they add a thing that every Kickstarter has, and since every Kickstarter does this, we’re doing this, and we’re telling you about it. WE GOT ACHIEVEMENT GOALS! Help us build our community (please make us look cool) and we'll upgrade our demo(s) with new songs and surprises! 

You'll get 1 point for each tier passed, and 10 points will unlock a brand new B-SIDE that will come to ARCADE MIX and [white label] - the mysterious FOREVER WHEN!
More goals will be added throughout the Kickstarter campaign - letting you unlock even more special rewards!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've already elaborated in "PIE CHARTS WITH JEFF" that the Kickstarter's base goal will not be enough to bring the game's production to completion by end of 2023. If the Kickstarter is funded, we intend on delivering this game no matter what - but the final amount we get will really play a part in how long we can keep going before its ready to search for partners to help bring the game to completion.

Regarding PHYSICAL MERCH: We have experience producing everything but artbooks, so for the most part, we are confident in delivering and shipping physical goods across the world. We will update on production deliveries, delays, and more throughout the campaign. COVID-19 regulations may continue affecting international shipping by the time we start to ship physical merch.

Spirit Swap: Lofi Beats to Match-3 To is an action-puzzle game set in a lush, narrative-driven world of witchy demons. Cast spells, be queer, & crash the biggest concert of the year!
By night, use Samar’s powers to help send transdimensional spirits back home. By day, roam the city and chat with friends, planning the ultimate pizza party for everyone to come together and catch up.
 Match to the beat as you reassemble lost spirits, and enjoy a custom lofi soundtrack by the incredible Meltycanon.
 Cast powerful spells. Arrange spirits into special patterns to unlock potent powers!
 Compete in local VS mode! Everything is chill, until it gets permanently unchill....
 Enjoy over 5 unique game modes, including Time Attack, Score Attack, and Survival.
 Bond with a cast of witches and demons. Plan a pizza party together, crash a concert, maybe even smooch in our extensive Story Mode!
 Decorate your bedroom. Earn trinkets and keepsakes as you play, then place them in Samar’s room to affect the game!
 No microtransactions here. Spirit Swap is a premium game, which means you'll be able to enjoy it without worrying about hidden costs.
 Queer and diverse joy. Much like the cast of Spirit Swap, our team is also is queer, Black, and/or POC, and it's well past time we see ourselves experiencing happiness in media. This is a slice-of-life story for players needing a relaxing experience!
 A fresh look at Middle Eastern fantasy by creators FROM the region. Spirit Swap is set in a fictional city inspired by the Levant, a region rarely explored (in a positive light) in games.
Samar - the main character!
Mo + Leon - the coolest people you know with soft centers.
the Polycule - these hot people are all dating wow
Pookie - giant teddy bear and BFF4LIFE
There are few things Ishk loves more than carb loading at Lulu's bakery, but maybe there’s something other than pastries that keeps him coming back around.
AND MORE CHARACTERS THAT WE'LL INTRODUCE AS THE CAMPAIGN PROGRESSES!
 NEW CHARACTER REVEAL: KANON

who ARE they????
 Match-3 action meets visual novel storytelling in Spirit Swap!
Inspired by Panel de Pon, Spirit Swap lets you use a keyboard or controller to move spirits into groups of three or more to help reassemble their forms, and send them back to their proper dimension. Throughout the game, you’ll improve your magical abilities and learn new spells by exploring the world and talking to your friends.
Story Mode progresses through various areas of the city, cleaning up different “hot spots” where transdimensional spirits have accidentally crossed over.
Outside of Story Mode, there will be additional game modes -- Time Attack and Score Attack will be available for those up for the challenge. For anyone wanting a chill experience (perhaps to help wind down for the evening), Endless Mode will be available as well!
Bhyg Mode will also be available! It's a local-versus mode where you can compete with up to seven other friends (eight players total) on a wonderfully chaotic shared board!
There’s more to life than work, though, and Samar and their friends will have opportunities to hang out, chat, and bond! Depending on who you visit and when, you’ll be able to develop a deeper relationship; plan a pizza party together, go to a concert… maybe even smooch! 
As Samar’s bonds with her friends grow deeper you’ll unlock unique dialogue, spells, and items. You’ll also be able to decorate Samar’s bedroom using those trinkets and keepsakes, and each of these will provide different boons to your match-3 strategy, in addition to making Samar’s room feel like home!
Spirit Swap’s world is inspired by the devs’ love for their Lebanese roots, lo-fi and wired technology, and the 90’s colorful aesthetic with a sprinkle of demonic vaporwave.
Samar is a young witch working the spirit-swapping night shift in the eastern outskirts of Demashq. A recent spike in spirits crossing over from another dimension breaks the chill atmosphere of their night shift. With her trusty FamiliarZ by her side, she sets off into the city to find out what’s happened. With the popular band, 5SOME, scheduled to kick off their big comeback tour in Demashq, Samar needs to work quickly before the city is overrun with stans and spirits alike....not to mention, they've got a pizza party to plan, and romance to pursue!
Spirit Swap takes place in Demashq, a coastal city inspired by the Levantine cities of our own world, Damascus and Beirut.
The game follows Samar as they make their way from their home right outside the city, by the nearby forest, into the sprawling coastal city of Demashq where they meet their friends.
one of Samar's possible paths through Demashq
It reflects the Levant’s general topography, nature, architecture and climate (middle eastern Mediterranean) as well as cultural references, vibrancy, and visual cues.
A setting seldom explored in games outside the lens of orientalism, and almost never by people from that part of the world themselves.
Spirit Swap’s in-world magic draws on two main things: plants and community. Plants and nature are the source of all magic and humans when banded together act as amplifiers and users. The world is one parallel to ours where plant magic was democratized around the turn of the millenia instead of wireless communication. Magic and tech have become deeply intertwined.
In a world where magic is at everyone’s fingertips, everyone needs a helping hand. For witches and demons alike, Familiars serve that purpose.
In the past, summoning a Familiar was a lengthy process.  Charting the constellations, preparing the ritual, and massive energy drain directly following the manifestation of an individual’s soul became less popular in modern times.  Yet, the need for a Familiar’s assistance and companionship did not.
FamiliarZ Concept Art
FamiliarZ were created to solve the problem; tech-assisted miniature devices that allow anyone to manifest a Familiar without the expense of magical energy required to sustain it.  With casings ranging from fashionable keychains to portable cassette players, witches and demons choose personalized ways to interact with their Familiar without having to reveal to the public any aspect of their inner selves.
FamiliarZ Concept Art
For press interested in covering our Kickstarter, here are some screenshots and promo material to get you started!
Our soundtrack and sound design are created by Meltycanon and eyelovebrandon. The audio team is led by Rejon Taylor-Foster.
For Spirit Swap, the soundtrack was inspired by the music our team is currently drawn to: lofi hip-hop. We wanted to create a game, and soundtrack, that you truly could relax to!
Please keep in mind: the reward images are mock-ups and WIPs, and the final products may look different. Thank you for understanding!

We have been working on this title for 8 months now, and have made great progress: this funding will allow us to dive even further into making Spirit Swap the game we’d love it to be.

The ability for Kickstarter to connect us quickly with a community of people as excited about Spirit Swap as we are is also something we wanted to explore. We’re excited to share developmental progress and all of the fun game elements we have in store with our community! Thank you for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the expertise of our team, having been a part of 11 shipped titles and various facets of the game industry, we are confident Spirit Swap is happening, one way or another!

What this Kickstarter campaign will do is help determine just how far we can go with this title. Our hope is that this campaign can give us the financial boost to add content, potentially bring it to consoles, and make sure it’s polished so that the final Spirit Swap experience is an incredible one. We’ve also partnered with Dual Wield Studio -- the merch partner for other games like Among Us and Best Friends Forever -- to ensure experience and support for physical reward deliveries.

Even with significant experience and preparation, game development can be unpredictable and delays are always a possibility. If the game feels unfinished, we prefer to continue working on it and delay its release until we are confident that you will enjoy the result! Thank you!

campaign.story:
Astor and friends hand-made eco-adventure! (Animated gif)
Discover a colorful sandbox open-world where you can farm wondrous plants, craft tools and shelter, harness the elements, and shape the land around you.

Play your own way - be clever, be creative or even be mischievous. Befriend strange beasts, dodge dangerous surprises, gather resources, and explore unique biomes to uncover the Secret of the TerraBeast.
Astor gifts a Mighty Beast their favorite treat.
You play as an Astor, a special OddFauna, whose biological imperative is to seek out TerraSeeds. You will have to form a symbiotic bond with your living world, your TerraBeast to discover the TerraSeed's location. Will you seek out the TerraSeed? That is up to you. 
The world is filled with OddFauna for you to meet.  Chat with them and get to know them. Give them their favorite treats to show you care. Earn their trust and you will receive items, recipes, or maybe even a new party member. Befriending a beast boosts your abilities and making a true friend will grant you a wearable pin which unlocks a new ability.
Many Beasts are friendly... if you know how to interact with them. Entice them with a special treat, help them to build a shelter, or even ask them to join you on an adventure!
Beware the beasts that come out at night! And watch out for the ones that may hide in bushes.


Tiny and gentle, the Sproutling help tend to the Terrabeast and are vital to a thriving ecosystem.
Transform your TerraBeast into your own adventure paradise. Your Terraform ability allows you to sculpt the ground like clay. Shape the landscape to fit your adventuring needs; create rivers and lakes to play in, raise mountains to gain a better view or create fields to farm your favorite treats. 
Sculpt the Landscape like Clay!
Go even further and alter the temperature, soil quality, and water level of biomes. Create a frozen desert, flooded forest, or arid grasslands.

Your choices have an impact on the other OddFauna. Ovoks love forests, Logurs need lots of water, and Trico's love it hot! Create a new habitat and new OddFauna will migrate and create a cozy home for themselves. 
Your growing ability allows you to craft astounding plants.  You have control over how they are shaped which grants you the freedom to use them for shelter, food, infrastructure, or just their beauty. 
Each crop has a season in which it can be grown. You will need a crop strategy to ensure that you have enough food and resources for the whole year. Being prepared for the start of the growing season will give you a head start on exploring!

Create your own unique flora by combining different seeds. Cross-pollinate to yield more fruit, improve quality, or to change the color of your plants.
Handfuls of berries, huge delicious fruit, yummy earth roots, and many more!
Gather and grow resources and craft them into handy items for your adventures.  Craft tools, sandbox toys, shelters, and accessories to adorn yourself.
Building a shelter not only replenishes your energy, but it also protects you from the creatures that lurk in the dark.
Everything in the world abides by the rules of nature. You can interact with everything you see in the world. Burn with fire or replenish with water, it is your choice. Experiment with different combinations of elements to make new discoveries.
Burn with fire & freeze with ice
Every action you take has an impact on the world. It is up to you to decide how to treat your world. You may choose to go on a fire-wielding rampage and burn down entire biomes. If you want to remedy your actions, you'll have to get your paws dirty and plant a new forest.

Allowing your TerraBeast to become unhealthy will present some tough challenges. Blight will begin to appear, spread, and destroy everything it touches. As weather events intensify, you’ll face lightning super storms, raging wildfires, and choking sandstorms, just to name a few!
A healthy TerraBeast will grow larger each season. This unlocks new areas for you to explore. New OddFauna, biomes, and crops will become available as the world grows larger. The outer rings of a fully mature TerraBeast have been known to be home to Legendary Beasts.
Astor, Trico & Mo are off to explore a newly grown forest.
Your home, a giant majestic TerraBeast
Your world is a massive living beast, called a TerraBeast. They have a very long lifespan. It's rumored they can live for millennia. Their backs are covered with a thick coat of organic material. It's a fertile land, an ideal place for life to take root. It's common for TerraBeast's organic carapace to form blight and attract unhealthy creatures. They rely upon Astors to help keep them healthy. It is unknown how TerraBeasts spawn-- it's believed that Astors may play a role.

The world of the Terrabeast is procedurally generated and will be different each time you begin a new adventure. As the world grows, your actions help to shape it. If you maintain a healthy TerraBeast, the new biomes that grow will be fertile and healthy. Do you want to create more forests? Plant lots of trees and new biomes will be forests too.

The world is divided into different biome types, Grasslands, Forest, Mountains, Desert, and many more! Each Biome attracts different OddFauna and has specific needs to remain healthy. 
OddFauna thrive in their favorite biomes.


Game Development Plan
The game is currently in Pre-Alpha and being developed for PC and will be released on Steam as an Early Access Game. (Wishlist Today!) Early Access will allow us to get it into player hands, get their feedback and have the time to use that feedback to shape the game. We are looking to our community of players to help us make the game as awesome as it can be. 

We are making Alpha & Beta Access available as reward tiers. If you want to get your paws on the game as early as possible back at those levels! Alpha and Beta members have access to special discord servers that we will be reaching out to for feedback. Alpha and Beta backers will be able to vote on certain game decisions and help steer the development of the game.

If the Kickstarter gets funded, it will allow us to port the game to the Nintendo Switch! We will be able to buy Switch dev kits and ensure the game will perform amazingly on the console. I am incredibly excited at the prospect of developing for my favorite console. It will be a lot of work, but with your support, we will make it happen. OddFauna promises to be amazing on Switch! The Switch version of the game is available as an add-on item and with an estimated delivery date of Q1 2023.
We are a husband and wife team. Emma is the Creative mastermind behind OddFauna. She has been creating the cast of characters for years now. A few years ago we started talking more and more about how great a video game would be in her world. Last year, Cliff quit his AAA game development job to make it a reality! We finally are able to expand this awesome universe, and it is such a privilege to get to partner together on this creative journey.
Our little family
Everything in the game is hand-sculpted by Emma. This gives the world a very unique style. They are then hand-painted by Emma and handed off to Cliff. Cliff Photoscans them cleans up the models. The animation style and the hand-crafted nature of the models gives the world a stop-motion type of feel, which we love.
Check out our updates for more on our process!!!
How a character gets created.
We've been developing OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast full-time now for a year, self-funding the project entirely with our life savings. For 2 people we have come a long way in a short amount of time. We are approximately 50% of the way through development. While we've made a lot of progress, there is still a lot of work to do. In order to continue to work and retain creative control, we need to ask for your help. We’re also hoping to build a community of passionate backers who want to be involved with the process of development. With your help, we believe we can build the best version of OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast that we possibly can!

"OddFauna is such a unique and beautifully handcrafted game, made by an indie developer who actively engages with their audience!" - Tiny Tay (Discord)
The vast majority of our budget goes directly into making the gameplay amazing, the visuals beautiful, and the sound gorgeous. We will expand to get assistance with the music and audio and be able to hire help for community management, QA, and marketing.

OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast is a true passion project of ours, and we've made a lot of financial sacrifices to get this far. We'll finish the game at a smaller scale even if this Kickstarter isn't funded, but the game will be bigger and better if we meet our fundraising goals!

Exclusive TerraBeast Hard Enamel Pin
A limited edition colorway exclusive to the Kickstarter. This hefty little friend measures 2" wide in hard enamel with shiny gold metal. We’re working with Alchemy Pins, whose products are beautifully made, with a very high attention to detail.

Exclusive TerraBeast Bandana
22" 100% cotton bandana with Emma's original TerraBeast design. Ice dyed and screen printed right here in Seattle by Ink Knife Press. Because of the nature of the dye, each one will be unique, making them extra special!


Exclusive "Ride" Collector Statue.
Designed by Emma, produced by Level 52 Studios. This limited edition high end collectible is a Kickstarter Exclusive.  3D scanned from Emma’s original sculptures, these statues will measure 8" and will be cast in Polystone. Packaged in a collectors box, they will come numbered and signed, with a certificate of authenticity.

Surprise Creature Painting!
These are original creature concept painting by Emma. Each piece measures 5x7 (or larger) and is painted in watercolor and ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. Each piece will come signed with the name of the creature on the back. There are only 30 different character paintings up for grabs and they will be shipped out blind box style. Which one will you get?
"Flying Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed, Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Flying Friends

"Adventuring Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x16 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Adventuring Friends

 "Together" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Together
"Astor and TerraBeast" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Astor and TerraBeast

Custom Legendary Beast Sculpture
Do you want an absolutely original OddFauna sculpture? Choose a few key features of the beast of your dreams, and Emma will do the rest. She will take your idea and turn it into a beautiful (or terrifying) art sculpture that will be the envy of all your beast loving friends! Sculpture can measure up to 11" and can have the same level of detail and complexity as the Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast seen here.
Legendary Beasts - Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast

Our Environmental Commitment
As we grow, we plan on donating and partnering with different organizations that are working towards rebuilding healthy ecosystems. Our first step is partnering with Eden Reforestation Projects. They hire local communities to plant a variety of native tree species in deforested areas. We will plant 1 tree per copy of the game sold.


Video BG Music : "5 minutes pleasure" by Hiroki Kikuta. Licensed under CC 4.0
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are an experienced team, and we understand many of the risks we face. Here are our plans to deal with these risks.

Financial risk: We are confident that this amount of funding will allow us to deliver a solid game that meets our goals. We have put a great deal of our own funds into the development so far. It was important to us to put our own money into the project first and get the game to a solid place before reaching out for support. We will continue to fund the game if the Kickstarter is not successful, but it will not be as big and polished as we are hoping.

Schedule risk: Our timeline is short, especially with only two of us working on the game. We have been meticulous about keeping the game in scope. To make sure we hit our goal, we have a roadmap that extends beyond shipping. A successful Kickstarter will allow us to hire experts to help in areas like music, community management, etc. This will allow us to focus on what we do best: making the game.

Gameplay : With just two people it can be challenging to make any game. Proper scope, experience, and passion is the key. With your support we will make OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast an amazing experience. We are very excited to continue this adventure with you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of the products that we will be offering as rewards will be manufactured at the highest quality. All of the higher reward tiers will be very limited and hand crafted by Emma SanCartier.
Sustainable materials
Our packaging consists of low-impact, recyclable materials.
Something else
We are partnering with the Eden Reforestation Projects and planting a tree for every copy of the game sold.
 
Additionally, we've decided to limit the physical rewards to just a few items and keep the focus on the game itself which will be available as a digital download.

campaign.story:
Nintendo characters come to life
In the early part of the last decade, the "Toys-to-Life" scene exploded in a big way. Physical figurines you owned contained technology that would allow them to interact with video games, and after Skylander's: Spyro's Aventure and Disney Infinity showed that the model was lucrative and viable, Nintendo joined the fray themselves with their amiibo range.
Debuting in 2014, the amiibo line has since seen more than 200 figurines released, with a wide ranging degree of functionality in titles on Nintendo platforms. Predominantly focused on core, Nintendo IP, the amiibo figurines do also contain characters from other franchises too. Although not as aggressive with the frequency as a few years ago, there are still new additions every year, and some of the older ones have become much more difficult to find as they have become discontinued.
With so many characters available - sometimes different versions of the same character in different ranges too - it would probably be helpful if there was some sort of handbook to have to, erm, hand.
Introducing The Unofficial amiibo Handbook. amiibo not included, obviously.
Presenting The Unofficial amiibo Handbook
That's where this little handbook comes in. With 208 amiibo currently obtainable via commericial means, it's a little compendium showcasing every single one of the little plastic (well, more resin really... some are wool!) recreations of some of the finest video game characters that have ever existed. Whether you intend to collect every single one, select ones or certain franchises, The Unofficial amiibo Handbook will have you covered, with excerpts for each character packed with information and fun facts. There's even approximate pricing should you wish to purchase them today.
Ah, fluffy wooly Yoshi! Or rather, 'Green Yarn Yoshi" as it is correctly known. No, you won't get free amiibo. Sorry.
Who is it written by?
Published under the Ninty Media branding, The Unofficial amiibo Handbook is completely written by Paul Murphy as his debut book. Paul has long been a huge Nintendo fan, and as well as creating Ninty Fresh Magazine and Switch Player Magazine, also happens to own every single amiibo. Well, the ones available via retail. Nobody really counts the exclusive golden ones that Capcom gave away in competitions. It has always been Paul's dream to write a book and it's quite fitting that something that started out of curiosity with a few Breath of the Wild characters culminated in something tangible after four years of collecting. The handbook is being designed by long-time Ninty Media Art Editor, Jhonatan Carneiro and is vibrant and colourful throughout. It's a proper book, we've applied for an ISBN number and everything and this will be the first print edition. Surely you want a first edition of someone's first book?
Example spread from the handbook and the cover. Pages are styled in a similar manner to the amiibo packaging.
Who is it for?
Ultimately, anyone who is a Nintendo fan, especially those with an interest in amiibo. Whether you have a passing interest in the range or have seriously entertained grabbing any, it's essential. And will go a long way to making someone's dream come true! If you've enjoyed Paul's writing or magazine projects, you will definitely enjoy this! Please help a silly Nintendo aficiondo's lifelong ambition come to fruition. It's packed with loads of fun facts as well. Did you know that there are 13 Link amiibo? 13? That's the most represented character! Did you know that Sonic didn't actually debut in Sonic the Hedgehog? Did you know that more than 30 amiibo have swords? There's 200+ more fascinating bits of insight as well as an overview on toys-to-life.
Nintendo recolouring amiibo really helped here! This images shows the different options available.
What reward options are available?
Handbook: Standard Edition
The standard option is for a print copy of the handbook, which will have more than 200 pages. It's perfectly pocket sized at A6 dimensions but will have a huge amount squeezed into that. It's currently projected to reach 40,000 words!
Handbook: Sponsor Edition (Including Early Bird)
If you wanted to support Paul's dream a little more and keep better track of your amiibo collecting needs, we have a level which will see your name added to the book as a sponsor to thank you, as well as an A2 sized checklist poster. This level also includes a digital download for the handbook. There are 500 of these in total, half of which are discounted "Early Bird" options which expire after a week!
Handbook: Super Mario 128 Edition
There's also a tier where Paul will personally dedicate your copy and number it; there will only be 128 signed copies, and all numbered accordingly in line with your backer number. These levels also come with a "Certified amiibo Fan" enamel badge, and backers of Ninty Fresh Magazine will be familiar with these!
You can also add extra posters badges or additional (discounted) copies of the handbook. Artwork subject to change.
What about add-ons?
This campaign has also allowed us to utilise add-ons. If you want additional copies of the magazine, or want to add badges and/or posters then you should be able to add more if you so desire. These will all be shipped to you in addition to what comes with your pledge.
Any Stretch Targets?
As we managed to hit our funding target in just a couple of hours, we have been asked about stretch goals and others things we can add to the project. Whilst the handbook and shipping models are more or less locked in (it was expected to be a certain weight) we do have a little wiggle room. As such we have slight amount of tolerance to add extras, and the first of these will be a little guide to the Pokémon Rumble U figures. A prescursor to amiibo, this range of Pokémon characters worked exclusively with Pokémon Rumble U. Obviously it wasn't long lived, but I thought it would be an interesting addition to the handbook! Rather than a monetary stretch target, I've set this as a backer-related one. Once we hit 1000 backers, this additional section will go into the handbook.
Example spread displaying different amiibo from other series. Paul has also tried to be funny and informative.
When will The Unofficial amiibo Handbook launch?
We have marked August as the launch for the handbook, but we do hope to have it packed and released long before the end of that month. Progress and updates will be communicated throughout the campaign. With 208 entries to write, Paul is currently writing between 4 and 8 per day and design is proceeding concurrently. Around 25% of the handbook has already been written. We will communicate regularly throughout to keep you up to date.
What about other books?
Let's get this one nailed on first! Paul does have other ideas and can see a possibility that this could become a range of "Little Nintendo Handbooks" but we need to get the first one funded first and we need your help to get this over the line.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having published and released over almost 100 independent print magazines, Ninty Media are well-versed at producing print-based content. The current global climate continues, but we don't anticipate any obstacles to producing this handbook.

Paul Murphy has now become a full-time games writer and is focusing on this handbook, writing 4-8 entries per day. At the time of this Kickstarter going live, approximately 25% of the book has been written already. That August release date is conservative, we do expect this handbook to launch before then.

Finish Line is in sight

campaign.story:
The Collectors USB Cassette series from Huey Games features the finest selection of retro-style games, delivered on a unique, nostalgia-inducing physical format. 
Badged as release 008 in the series, the Collectors USB Cassette double-pack of The Darkside Detective: A Fumble in the Dark and the original The Darkside Detective is an exclusive physical edition of this classic game for Windows, Linux & Mac (DRM-free), designed to slot seamlessly into your retro gaming collection. This unique format allows us to load the USB drive with a tonne of special features including soundtrack albums, artwork, retro archives and more. 
There are two types of USB Cassette available for backers - the £25 Collectors version and the premium £45 Ultra USB Cassette. There is also a super-exclusive Elite Edition bundle for £80.
£25 - Kickstarter backers SAVE £4.99 compared to the standard retail price!
The Collectors USB Cassette comes shrink wrapped in a genuine cassette jewel case, with colour printed labels and inlay - exactly like your classic cassette games. 
£45 - Kickstarter backer EXCLUSIVE!
Upgrade to the Ultra USB Cassette for a premium fold-out inlay, exclusive UV-LED printed finish on the cassette with spot varnish logo, ultra verification card, obi-strip presentation sleeve and extra bonus features, in addition to everything from the Collectors tier. 
£80 - Kickstarter backers EXCLUSIVE!
Everything from the Ultra tier plus you get an exclusive optical crystal award, etched with the 006 logo and Elite Backer emblem, and a signed Certificate of Authenticity verifying you as an Elite Backer. 
Build your own custom bundle by choosing any of our premium add-ons after selecting your reward tier: 
Delouse your room with sage and pack up your travel-sized ouija board, it’s time to re-enter Twin Lakes - America’s 34th most haunted city. Join Detective McQueen as he puzzles his way through 6 chilling cases, risking life and pixelated limb to solve the macabre mysteries that plague the poor town.
Twin Lakes is a cursed city. Less cursed than say, “Demons are tearing it apart” but more cursed than “always loses its keys” or “often steps in puddles”. It’s roughly in the middle of the cursed scale, is what we’re trying to say.
Cursed enough that it’s a nuisance. Cursed enough that somebody has to deal with it...
That’s where The Darkside Detective comes in. Whenever you hear a bump in the night, feel a tingle up your spine, or smell something fishy, Detective Francis McQueen isn’t far behind. 
No, he doesn’t smell of fish - it’s a phrase, come on...
Picking up after the events of The Darkside Detective, McQueen has to save his usually-present (in body, if not mind) sidekick Officer Dooley from the Darkside, so the two can get back to what they do best - investigating the city’s many strange, often paranormal, always paradoxical goings-on. 
Join them in this frighteningly funny point-and-click adventure as they investigate six more standalone cases bringing them to a carnival, the local retirement home, an amateur wrestling circuit and even as far away as Ireland as they do what they can to keep the Darkside at bay.
6 unique cases, the likes of which you’ve never seen before (not a guarantee)
Uses both pointing and clicking technology
Music from Thomas O'Boyle, a totally-living composer, definitely not undead
Photo-Realistic* Pixel Rendering (*Depends on your definition of photo-realism)
1 mail-in rebate per customer on exorcism services for hauntings resulting from play
A brief recap of the events of The Darkside Detective for anyone who hasn't played it and doesn't want to
And don't forget, since this is a double-pack, you also get the multi-award-winning original The Darkside Detective.
In addition to the DRM-free Windows, Mac & Linux versions of the game, the USB Cassette also comes loaded with a host of special features: 
Spooky Doorway is a band of Irish developers who make small adventure games with a focus on light-hearted and caring narratives.
The Darkside Detective is rated ‘Overwhelmingly Positive’ on Steam and they have won a few awards and landed some grants, which makes them feel like big fish.
Paul, the CEO, handles the art and most of the business side of things;
Treasa is lead programmer, scrum mistress and co-designer;
Dave co-designs, writes and does some low-level dev work.
And, unlike The Beatles, we get by with a lot of help from our friends:
 Hannah does wonderful coding bits!
 Ruth, Ruthie and Mark help with 3D art!
 Ben and Thomas made music and sounds. Beep beep, boop boop!
 Rob and David test things!
Our intern, Sean, did all sorts like program and testing!
 Charlie and KA Games help us get the word out there!
 Warlocs translated Darkside into French, German and Spanish!
 Maple Whispering translated it into Chinese and published it there!
 Super Rare Games published the limited physical edition for Switch!
 Creative Europe MEDIA gave us funds to develop Sunken Spectre!
All of you who bought Darkside Detective Season 1!
And everyone who Kickstarted Season 2!
Thanks to every one of the above (and anyone we missed…) for all the help and support over the years – here’s to many more!
Huey Games continues the legacy of Andrew Hewson's famous 1980s software house, which published hit titles on cassette including Uridium, Paradroid, Nebulus, Cybernoid, Exolon, Avalon, Quazatron and many more.
Rob Hewson, previously a Game Director on the LEGO series of games, and John Ogden, a veteran Technical Lead of more than 2 decades, head up the modern studio. Huey Games creates, ports and publishes games for consoles, PC, Mac and mobile. 
We're producing the Collectors USB Cassette for you to enjoy and appreciate, and we want to be as transparent as possible about the process. We vouch to provide regular updates on the progress of the project via Kickstarter, and to let you know about our successes and challenges along the way. 
A special thanks to GamesYouLoved who are supporting this campaign. GamesYouLoved is born out a love of retro games of every description from your childhood. By being reminded of the retro games through images and video, what people say about them and things you were doing at the time, you are unlocking these memories to see, share and enjoy. They love retro gaming!

Risks and challenges
Huey Games have run and delivered on successful Kickstarter campaigns of our own, and have worked on or promoted successful Kickstarter campaigns for other people too.

The Darkside Detective and The Darkside Detective: A Fumble in the Dark are complete games, but we are dependent on our suppliers for the USB Cassettes. Having worked with the supplier on multiple past projects, we have established a good business relationship and we trust them to deliver, but we cannot rule out all risk of problems or delays with the delivery of the USB Cassettes.

The majority of the bonus content for the USB Cassettes is already mastered, but there is a small risk of some content changing or being replaced before final delivery, especially for any stretch goal content which has not already been produced. As with our previous campaigns, we take pride in delivering quality products and will always aim to over-deliver and to replace any problematic content with content of equivalent or superior value.

campaign.story:
Retake Earth one scrapyard at a time in Wastenauts - an online multiplayer cooperative dungeon crawling RPG card game. Grab your friends and explore what's left of the surface. Fight some machines. Blow 'em up for parts. Put the parts back together to make cool toys. Or sell 'em. You do you, Diver.
Features
Co-op as an additive experience: As long-time board and card game fans, we built this game to play with each other. That doesn't mean you can't go it solo - the party's four characters can be controlled by one to four players.
An ever-changing wasteland: No two game sessions will ever be quite the same. You're exploring - and fighting against - a location deck, and what goes into that deck, well, who knows?
Bring-your-own-game: In Adventure Mode, you craft the location deck. Stuff it full of monsters, or just put in a bunch of loot. Easy, hard, brutal - build the experience you want to play and then grab a few friends to share it with.
 Have a listen as you read to set the mood. 
Humanity has been chased off the surface by possessed machines. We live in giant city ships, far outside the robots' influence, while they strip our home of its resources. The only people insane enough to save our asses by going down there and fighting to bring materials back are the Divers.
For the entire duration of our Kickstarter campaign, our servers will be live for you to play Wastenauts online with friends new and old. It's a great opportunity to play what we've made so far!
There are three ways to get into the alpha - choose what's best for you:
 Sign up to Playtest directly on Steam - we're processing these requests daily, so bear with us on some delays
 Ping us on Discord - join the Discord and we'll message you a Steam key ASAP
 Download the latest on Game Jolt - for our non-Steamers, a downloadable build is available on Game Jolt
 Request a key on Rainmaker - if you're a content creator on Twitch, Facebook, or Youtube, we've partnered with Rainmaker.gg to distribute keys so you can play the game for your channel
Right now, the alpha includes over 100 cards, five playable characters, and two zones - plenty of content to get a great feel for the game. Please note that alpha access will be restricted to backers after the campaign closes. 
The best way to learn how to play is to dig into the free alpha (which has a tutorial!), but who doesn't love a rulebook?
At the start of the game, a timed skylight is launched, and will alert a passing cityship to come pick you up after a set number of days. You'll only have that limited time to get as many resources as you can!
Each day of Wastenauts is broken into two phases: exploration and camp. During the exploration phase, players take turns drawing cards from a shared zone deck and responding to what they've drawn. Loot and resources get added to your hand, events require some choices to be made, and of course monsters need to be fought. Use abilities from your hand to boost your damage, and then roll dice to deal damage to the bots and scavs you find in the deck.
Roll dice to fight monsters in combat, and increase your dice pool with gear, abilities, and more!
After every team draws their cards, play turns to the camp phase. Think of camp as “returning to town” in your favorite dungeon crawler - here you'll be able to craft new gear, trade items with your party members, and strategize for the next exploration phase. Certain abilities will allow you to make the most of your camp phase, including scouting the deck, healing injuries, and more.
Use the camp phase to plan for the next day, including scouting and rearranging the deck!
When your days are up, the skylight goes off and it's time to beat back whatever bosses have been attracted by it. Use all the tools you've got in an all-out fight, because if you lose here, you'll be heading skyside empty-handed.
After a set number of days, a boss will appear - beat it to fight your way back home!
After each session, use your loot to purchase new cards for the next trip - abilities, blueprints, and even monsters to add to the deck and make it harder. The harder your next dive, the better the rewards!
Use salvage to upgrade buildings on the ship, including the store where you can buy new cards!
Equip ability cards before diving, and use them to survive until the boss!
Ability cards are the core of every Diver's arsenal. Each ability has a unique effect suited to its owner, from combat-oriented effects to deck manipulation and more. Most ability cards stay with you the entire game, and you'll come to rely on them heavily as you work your way through the deck. Before playing a game you'll choose from your library of ability cards which few you'd like to bring. Some work better with others from other characters, and some are better suited to specific locations, so check with your teammates to figure out the perfect loadout!
Craft gear as you make your way through the deck out of a library of blueprints!
Quick wit and gumption aren't going to cut it on the surface - you're going to need the right equipment. Well, you're going to need some equipment. You'll unlock a library of gear blueprint cards to take into every dive with you, some of which are general purpose and some of which can only be crafted by a single character. Be warned though, once crafted these things are pieces of junk. While you'll keep the blueprints forever, you'll need to craft them every time you reach the surface. They won't last the trip back home.
From unruly scavengers to possessed robots, each deck is jam-packed with monsters. And you can pack it further. Unlock harder and stronger monster cards and add them to the deck in Adventure Mode for more rewards. You'll grab what loot you can from downing scavengers, but KO'ing bots will add them to your hand. Bots can be disassembled for all kinds of good stuff at camp, including parts to craft your gear blueprints. Or, keep dead bots in your hand and use them to power certain ability and gear cards.
You've jumped off the side of a floating cityship for a reason, not just for the fun of it. You're here to try to gather some resources and bring them back and keep civilization afloat. Salvage cards can be used after each session to increase the rank of buildings on your ship, allowing you to unlock more cards, upgrade the ones you have, and more. But salvage cards can also be used to craft gear blueprints. How badly do you really need to craft that microphone, Lena?
Most people fled the surface when the robots attacked, but that doesn't mean the surface is empty. Event cards throughout the deck represent random encounters on your dive, from freak Flitstorms to groups of fleeing refugees. Many of these cards require the party to make strategic choices about how to resolve them.
There are dozens of other card types in Wastenauts already. Finding Bits as you adventure will improve your attack card for that session. NPC cards will unlock new systems and quests. Found Gear can grant you a temporary additional ability card. Rare Resources can be used by the Clergy to permanently upgrade your cards. Augment cards can directly improve a character's speed, power, health and more.  And we have plans to add so many more!

Want to learn more? The official community wiki has enough info for the most intense buildcrafters.
Kickstarter gives us a great way to work directly with fans of the game and continue to build a community around Wastenauts. It's a fantastic tool for communication with all y'all, and allows us to make exclusive items for the game that we otherwise wouldn't be able to.
If you've played the alpha, you've undoubtedly seen our favorite "TEMP ART". Your contributions will not only help expedite the art for these cards, it will also go towards the addition of visual effects, development, and more.
Our goal is to get you the Discord Role and Dice Skin as soon as possible after you back the game. That way you can play the alpha while showing off your backer status!
Let the hunks of junk on the surface know you've got each other's backs with this animated portrait frame. At launch both you and your friend will unlock the heart-shaped frame to assign to your characters. These portrait frames power up whenever you play with your refer-a-friend buddy.
Here's what you do:
Back the Kickstarter

On the survey we send in May, tell us your friend's email 
Thanks so much for stopping by our page! There are so many ways to help us fund outside of the campaign.
Play the alpha! Our alpha is live all campaign whether you've backed us or not.
Tweet us out! #Wastenauts
Tell your friends!
Wishlist us on Steam! Even if you've backed us at a tier to get the game, your wishlist before launch helps us tremendously!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our challenges include those typical to game projects, such as keeping the scope to a manageable space, and the time requirements for a small team to crank out content. We hope that the campaign-long alpha, which you can play right now, shows you the work we've put into the game and confirms our commitment to see it through.

At this juncture we do not anticipate we will be further impacted by Covid-19, as our team has managed to successfully transition to a workflow during this period. 

Our greatest risk to this project comes from a lack of visibility. Although we will always support a single-player mode for the game, Wastenauts is best with other friends and when the servers are full of new Divers. To mitigate this, we've built a significant marketing budget into our campaign to help us promote launch at a large scale.

campaign.story:
We just put together this MEET THE MAKERS micro doc (a few of them at least). Please, enjoy, and share it if you like it - WE ARE IN THE HOME STRETCH NOW!
More is more in Vokabulantis and these stretch goals will get us all a lot more of it!   
Vokabulantis is a love-driven co-op platformer adventure. The game is inspired by games like Inside, Unravel and Little Nightmares, yet it's made by hand. 
Join Kurt and Karla in their struggle to restore peace to Vokabulantis - and to express their feelings for each other after their words have been taken away. 
Stop motion gameplay animation of Karla by Frej Bengtsson
CONCEPT ART: The enormous and beautiful Verbe Carbs bring life and movement to everything in Vokabulantis. They are a vital part of the world or rather have been before. They are now cut off. The Word Führer’s waist has them cornered and out of influence.
 "I got 4 kids and I want them to play Vokabulantis. They should get scared, laugh, cry, concentrate and be entertained out of their minds. They don't always need sugar coated pop to feel entertained. It's important to me, they get great alternatives. They last!"  
Game designer - Esben Kjær Ravn
GAMEPLAY - Karla lends Kurt a hand
You enter Vokabulantis just as Kurt and Karla are about to say, what they feel for one another.
Actually they've just found themselves stuck in that moment unable to get a word out, and then suddenly they are thrown into Vokabulantis.
Here the kids have to embark on an epic quest to save the world of language. If they fail, they will be stuck in that moment forever.
They may never get to say, what they want to say to each other.
The intro scene from the Vokabulantis manuscript
The game can be played as a single player or as co-op. It is targeted for all major platforms, but thus far we can guarantee you a Steam release. 
Full story play-through of 6-8 hours of gameplay and an additional 2-4 hours if you hunt for all the hidden quirks and achievements of Vokabulantis.
The game design of Vokabulantis is guided by a novel dogma we call Emotional Mechanics.
Everything in the game is designed to make you feel, what the characters feel. You are not being told what they feel, but you feel, what they feel, because of the game design. 
Under that dogma rhythm based levels with a pumping beat spark irresistible joy as the protagonists just survived a life threatening mission. 
Your sudden ability to float kindles the feeling of relief having found each other again, when you thought all hope was lost.
So happy you could fly? We are prototyping levels, that make you feel like anything is possible. The level designs are really there for you, they want you to succeed. It's gonna feel like bubbly joy!
Some places the world opens itself up as you journey through it effortlessly, and you feel so confident, that you start to believe everything turns out the way you want it.
You can experience much darker emotions, where each character is trapped alone in illogical split screens mirroring the insanity of your inability to connect with someone.
Feeling alone? One of the Emotional Mechanics we are currently prototyping is a splitscreen mechanic, where you are isolated with each character, but you can try to manipulate the split screens to see, if you may find away through the insanity.
You also get to tap into the bond forming between the kids and their literal distance will start influencing the level.
Be aware of being close and giving space is key to any succesful relationship - In Vokabulantis, that becomes an actual gameplay mechanic, where the distance between the players is part of the level design.
These emotional mechanics and many more are currently in development and we love to get to a place, where we can start showing them off to you for real! 
Within the emotional mechanic dogma, you'll also experience relatable and recognizable classical platforming throughout the game - Kurt raises the rope Karla hangs on to by activating a word power zone
 "When I build puppets I put so much time and love into them, and it's hard to let them go when handing them over to the animators. But here I'm able to "animate" them myself in a sense, when I play. It feels like I breath life into my puppets. And I simply love that." 
Action based gameplay - Karla rocking some classic platforming skills

Put the sketches for the music of Vokabulantis in your ears and enjoy the art concepts below. That should give you a sense of how it feels to visit Vokabulanits.
CLICK IMAGE TO SEE IN FULL SIZE - Map of Vokabulantis
CONCEPT ART: In Vokabulantis the most precious material is Word Crystal. Although the vast word-crystal mines are beautiful and bountiful, they are now scarce, since they became controlled by the Word Führer.
CONCEPT ART: The refinery of Word Crystal uses vast amounts of Wordpower. It corrupts and poluts Vokabulantis. But the Word Führer is only interested in complete control and adherence to the rules.
 "I've built my own studio, I didn't take any formal education, so everything has always been possible to me in a sense. But this is really taking it to a new level. My field of art is literally evolving through this project. Never have stop motion been this dynamic and interactive. To be able to bring this to stop motion makes me proud." 
Stop Motion and game director - Johan Oettinger

CONCEPT ART: Old mining machinery and trash are everywhere in the underworld of Vokabulantis, where the corrupted Wordpower has twisted the minds of the creatures living there, and forced them into a hidden existence and uncanny presence.
CONCEPT ART: Deep in old tunnels and caves of the mines Numeralia hides. She is the powerful Witch of Numbers - a fiery old femmes fatales or treacherously innocent child of all ages, but Kurt and Karla need her help.
CONCEPT ART: To save the Verbe Carbs Kurt and Karla must travel across vokabulantis. When they finally reach the lake of the Verbe-Carbs things are not what they seem.
CONCEPT ART: The forest of thought called Pando was once a beautiful flourishing network of interaction. But the wild pollution of Vokabulantis has frozen Pando and left it in darkness.
CONCEPT ART: The City of Noun is a storage facility bigger than any city in our world. Here everything that has a name has a container in the container towers. The Kustodian of the city is an eccentric old robot with a few loose fuses.
CONCEPT ART: The Custodian sends Kurt and Karla to the giant Rose Gardens. They must return Grandma Marble’s head there. It turns out she is more powerful and demanding than the Custodian had let them know - an ancient force like the Word Führer.
CONCEPT ART: Kurt and Karla desperately need help from the swamp of the Article Heads. The kids have lost themselves, or rather their self, crossing the giant mirror palace. The Article Heads hold the power to change the unspecific to something specific and vice versa.
You get seamlessly in and out of cutscenes. This approach draws you close to the characters and their story as the hand crafted experience brings real life to the game.
An in game shift between gameplay and cutscene
Cutscene of Kurt comforting Karla after fall and the Custodian with his mind on other things

Here's is how we make stop motion and handcrafted sets end up as dynamic gameplay.  
In the studio we shoot each frame in the stop motion animation several times with different lightings. See why below...
With the extended process, when doing the stop motion photography described above, we are able to light our characters dynamically in Unity, making them blend seamlessly in the environments of the game.
This is photogrammetry in action. Photogrammetry is the technique we use to 3D scan handcrafted models.
Through these technical solutions all our real life handcrafted objects and animations are brought to life digitally.
Stop motion animation of Kurt crawling up a 3D concrete block. He passes through light and shadow.
Cutscene that has been assembled and lit digitally from handcrafted set elements and animations.
This is a video of the handcrafted and scanned and ready for the game 3D versions:
PLAY

We ensure the handcrafting is well thought out and tested before it's created by following these steps:
Ida Asferg Jakobsen and Bent Ejaas working on Karla
Here's a small video of an array of props, characters and set elements, that have akreadt been handcrafted for Vokabulantis:   
PLAY

Karla and Kurt have found their way to the part of City Of Noun, that no longer functions as a giant storage facility and now unemployed Worders are building small settlements on the abandoned structures and farming their mushrooms there - The scene is setup and lit in 3D in the game engine Unity. Everything is 3D except the two kids and Yarn Broccoli in the background, that are all photos simulating 3D.
Vokabulantis is made by a team of the most talented and experienced people from game development and stop motion animation. 
They work within the game development studio Kong Orange and the stop motion animation studio Wired Fly - the production company duo, that undertakes the development of Vokabulantis. 
We work with top shelf stop motion talent, who are veterans of Aardman, Laika and Lego stop motion productions.
The game development team has launched several titles between them, most notably Felix The Reaper in the fall of 2019.
Ida (Handcrafting and Puppet Workshop Lead) - Mikkel (Concept Artist) - Martín (Concept Artist) - Morten (Concept Founder & Story world poet and author) -  Johan (Concept founder & Stop Motion Studio Wired Fly Owner/Head) - Esben (Game Studio Kong Orange Owner/Head) - Hannah (Masterful puppet builder) - Julia (Feature Stop Motion Animator, Teacher and Author) - Frej (Feature Stop Motion Animator, Filmmaker) - Danail (Feature Stop Motion Animator) - Daniel B (Programmer) - Casper C (Computer Graphics Artist) - Casper K (Computer Graphics Artist) - Nicolas (Audio and Music) - Christophe (Feature Stop Motion Animator) - Kristoffer (Programmer) - Daniel H (Programmer) - Nils (Level Design Lead) - Esben D (Programmer) - Boris (Co-Author) - Johnny (Level Design) - Sofie (Puppet Builder) - Stellan (Prop and Model Maker) - Katrine (Prop, storyboarder and model maker) - Andy (Feature Stop Motion Animator) - John (CG Artist) - Marie Cattiaut  (Animator) - Camille Scudier (Prop and Puppet maker) Margaux Humblet (Prop Maker)
Kurt and Karla gets brief by the Custodian who is fairly insensitive to the fact, that they lost their mouths
Two stop motion animated characters we will ad if we reach the relevant stretch goal - Numeralia and Yarn Broccoli
The Custodian and a Dust Bug waiting to be part of the Vokabulantis experience
If you have stretch goals to suggest, let us know, and we'll look into adding them. 
Bang! This is an exclusive album only obtainable through this campaign, it comes in at €255,- or higher, including the pins below. You can already listen to some of Nicolas Vetterli's sketches for the soundtrack here on this page. Look for the Soundcloud link. (*Art not final)
Pins, yes?! We want them. And we want to make them as Karla and Kurt'ish as possible. They are included in the €115,- (on the left) and €165,- (both) rewards. (*Art not final)
How Karla and Kurt reacted, when they saw we reached the Kickstarter goal! Now let's all give them some more to celebrate and move for the stretch goals, right?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
YES, WE HAVE A NOVEL PRODUCTION PIPELINE
But we have worked on it through grants from the Danish Film Institute and EU among others. This has allowed us to work out and minimize the risk involved here, since we've been able to carry a lot of the heavy lifting already at this point. 

YES, WE HAVE HAD OTHER PARTNERS
It will not only be you, that carries us all the way to the finish line, meaning we are beholden to other partners as well. We consider it a strength, that we have already proven, we are able to attract these, which will also be crucial to secure future collaborating partners. We find it overly optimistic to hope to stay fully independent with such a big project as Vokabulantis. We do believe however, that a good Kickstarter campaign result, will help us maintain as much independency as possible in the end.

YES, WE'LL NEED EVEN MORE PARTNERS IN THE END
Unless this Kickstarter campaign blows through all expectations and we come out way stronger than expected, we do need future partners on top of it. We consider a succesful kickstarter the final boost we need to bring on one or two partners, be it publishers or other parties, that will enable us to finalize the game. Those parties, will be much more comfortable joining the project, when they've seen a powerful Kickstarter performance of Vokabulantis beforehand. 

YES, WE ARE IN A FAIRLY EARLY STATE OF DEVELOPMENT
Even though we have worked on this game for quite a while and we have nailed some critical tech art pipeline developments, we do need more time. So this game will not be finished within the next two years. More likely three years. So we are asking you to join us for the ride and hopefully for a uniquely handcrafted one of a kind. We look forward to hopefully spending the coming years in your company!
