Hello Watchers!
So continuing from our last post, there's a few reasons we've kept our KS page up for a bit longer while we wind down before shutting it down completely - and that's so we can give backers warning and ask you a few questions regarding the development of our game.
So we'll address a few things here -

updates.update_userinfo: Ending the Kickstarter campaign in the next couple days, but not before we get your opinions!
updates.update_content:
DAMN! looks like we got eclipsed by a bunch of (pretty awesome) gaming news stories on the first few days of our Kickstarter, which had a big effect on our trajectory and reach - and also served to teach us a few valuable lessons as well as provide great insight.

We want to thank everyone from the bottom of our hearts for their generosity and support in making Demons Ate My Neighbors a reality - and humbly ask for a little patience as we stop THIS current Kickstarter campaign shortly to focus on some major improvements.

But FEAR NOT! The dead don't die! The attention you helped bring us has unearthed some great opportunities - we'll be back, stronger than ever - with a new goal and stronger campaign with more fleshed out backer tiers - around late September / early October - this time, for all major systems, not just Switch & PC - but for PSN, XBOX, PC & Switch!!! And with better physical rewards for those of you who love to kick-it old school.

We've got a few other surprises and exciting things to share as well, so STAY TUNED!
We appreciate you all, and by the metrics of most Kickstarters, this was a smashing success with over $40,000 raised in just 3 days - so we would be honored if you continued your support for what will be an even more exciting product when we launch our NEW Kickstarter soon.
Follow @ on Twitter for the latest updates.

After all, games, especially roguelites - are about falling and starting over again, with more skill and knowledge than you had before. Totally on-brand.

We shall rise again in a few short weeks time, enough to make for a spooktacular October... until then, loyal Watchers - Drop in, Turn Up and TUNE OUT!!
We hope to see you soon!

Stay pumped.

- Kian Matthew Naderi
(Director, Demons Ate My Neighbors)

updates.update_content:
Today’s topic is the OverPump mechanic on your Splasha and your pressure gauge.
As we mentioned yesterday, when you spray water from your Splasha, your water pressure goes down. While it does recover automatically, its a slow process, and pumping with Left Trigger helps you get back to full splashing sooner than later.
When your Splasha gets too full, as in, you pump beyond the pressure capacity, you can load an OverPump Blast. This is a valuable tool for getting past big crowds, and most types of OverPump have either a wide range of attack, a powerful direct attack, or a big pushback effect.

campaign.story:
Wishlist us now on Steam!
Mad Mimic is an indie game developer based in Brazil, that has been making games since 2017. In 2017, we successfully launched No Heroes Here across multiple platforms and we were selected as one of the winners of the PAX10 independent game showcase. Currently, we are working on our third title known as Dandy Ace!
Coming from a variety of backgrounds, the people on our team have in common both their love for video games as well as having strong commitment to designing and developing games that are more than a product, they are games that contribute to the medium, games that make us proud.
Experienced in designing content for many different genres, many of our teammates are graduates from the famous Vancouver Film School, including one of our founders, with skills we can put to the test in our projects in order to deliver the best of their know-how and talent.
We've learned a lot from the development and launch of No Heroes Here and Monica e a Guarda dos Coelhos and it has helped in the development of our third title, Dandy Ace.
As with every project, setbacks may occur and we will work hard to prevent and avoid delays or minimize them as much as possible. We don't expect delays with the production of the rewards and physical goods. So far, we are on track and very proud of the goals accomplished!
We want to add some extras to the game, and we can only do that with this Kickstarter and its stretch goals. We are 200% committed to the project and have enjoyed the development process as much as we hope you enjoy the game once it is in your hands. We've been working on Dandy Ace by ourselves up until now, fully devoting our time and effort into this project. While a majority of core game concepts we had envisioned for the project have come to fruition, there are still many things we would like to do prior to the full release of the game. This is where we need your help. Crowdfunding provides us with several opportunities to directly reach new players and engage our community, not only through funding but through feedback and ideas as well. We'll be inviting backers to test development builds and communicate with our team leading up to launch.
There are two primary things we hope to accomplish with our Kickstarter campaign. First, we would like to avoid possible Early Access and continue to improve and add features within Dandy Ace to confidently launch the title fully across each platform once it is ready. The second goal of the Kickstarter is to bring more awareness to the game and reach new potential players. We've grown an amazing supportive community of players around Dandy Ace's development so far and hope to continue to do so on a larger scale. A Kickstarter campaign also allows for our community and backers to become more involved in the development process leading up to launch while also supporting our efforts directly.
 Dandy Ace is an over the top roguelike experience that follows a fabulous magician seeking to combine and use his magical cards while fighting and looting his way to defeat the Green-Eyed Illusionist, Lele, who has imprisoned him in a cursed mirror.
Play as Dandy Ace, the amazing hero, and survive the challenges of the extravagant, lavish and ever changing palace created to defeat him filled with bizarre creatures and outrageous bosses. Find all of the magical cards, gather shards and gold, and get help from his assistants and unconventional allies.
 Dandy Ace will be coming to PC, Playstation, Xbox, and Switch. The initial launch will be for PC with the consoles to follow in the months after.
Story
Lele, also known as the Green-Eyed Illusionist, always dreamed of becoming the world's greatest magician. However, he was never able to be taken seriously due to his lack of skill and his tacky appearance. At his lowest point, Lele witnessed the rise of a brilliant prodigy magician named Dandy Ace. The conflict between admiration and envy soon became an obsession, as he decided to try to get rid of the talented young magician. Lele exchanged his soul in order to use the spell of the Cursed Mirror to trap Ace inside of it forever.
Inside the Cursed Mirror, Lele became the king. He created a bizarre palace, filled with trials and creatures, with the goal of humiliating Ace. Due to Lele's desire to watch the young magician fail repeatedly, every time Ace is defeated, he is forced back to the beginning. In order to escape and break the curse, Dandy Ace has to use all of his magic cards and incredible performances to defeat the different enemies found within the Cursed Mirror and take down Lele.
Dandy Ace vs Boss Axolangelo, the Master Painter
Try, die and try again until you beat the Green-Eyed Illusionist with the replayability and adrenaline of a rogue-like but with permanent upgrades that make you stronger as you continue to reach new levels and progress further with each run!
2D isometric fast-paced action with lots of challenging but fair combat engagements. Battle your way through bizarre creatures and outrageous bosses while building up your own arsenal of magic.
 The Magical Cards 
Dandy Ace’s core mechanic revolves around the Magical Cards which act as skills in the game. Players are able to create countless combinations of skills, upgrades, and play styles by combining the different cards they come across on each run.
Every Magical Card has a default skill associated with it. These skills can be upgraded further by combining another Magical Card with it. Players can find stronger versions of cards as they progress through the levels and experiment with the different skills. Players are not guaranteed the same cards each run so it will be important to learn them all!
The cards fall into 3 main categories: Blue, Pink, and Yellow
Movement skill cards are divided between two types: Dashes and Blinks.
These cards are often divided into Melee and Ranged Skills.
These cards have the widest variety of mechanics, from giant barriers & personal shields to giant slow fields!
Dandy Ace
The game's protagonist is none other than one of the greatest magicians alive, the dashing Dandy Ace. Ace is a rising star full of confidence and extremely charismatic. Even in defeat, Ace's confidence remains unshaken in his quest to defeat Lele, the Green-Eyed Illusionist, and escape from the cursed mirror.
 Lele, the Green-Eyed Illusionist 
Lele is the main antagonist of Dandy Ace. A magician himself, Lele both admires and hates Ace. As his obsession with Ace grew and his own popularity dropped, Lele sold his soul and trapped Ace inside of the Cursed Mirror.
Enemies
The enemies found within the Cursed Mirror are bizarre creations from Lele's imagination with the only purpose of denying Ace's escape. Ace will also run into some of Lele's prestigious palace guests and unique bosses as he progresses through the various stages providing players with more challenging encounters. Here you can find a few of them!
 Bunny Butler & Bunny Jester 
The Bunny Butler & Bunny Jester are the most common and basic enemies Dandy Ace will encounter. The Bunny Butler is a melee based enemy looking to charge at Ace whereas the Bunny Jester attacks from range.
Cuckoo Nightmare
 The Cuckoo Nightmare is a tankier enemy Ace must face fairly early on with a wide range of attacks for both up close encounters and at range.
Turrets & Totems
Stationary enemies that fire projectiles towards Dandy Ace. There are several different types of Turrets that Ace will encounter including Homing Turrets, Poison Turrets, and Multi-Shot Turrets.
Similar to Turrets, Totems are static enemies. These enemies do not attack Ace though, they provide Auras around them buffing other enemy creatures and creating more unique combat scenarios. These were created by Lele as bizarre furniture items decorating the Cursed Mirror realm.
Oozes
These slime-like creatures split off into multiple smaller versions of themselves during combat forcing Ace to deal with multiple Oozes at once when visiting the Garden.
Lady Fan & Lady Hook
These are Lele’s palace guests and some of the strongest enemies encountered in the Cursed Mirror. Lady Fan is the first humanoid enemy Ace comes across and she isn't to be underestimated. Lady Hook is a more challenging version of this enemy and another humanoid that is able to use her hook projectile to pull Ace.
Bosses
Besides Lele, there are several different complex bosses Ace will need to defeat to escape the Cursed Mirror. Each boss has unique mechanics that will test Dandy Ace and prepare him for the fight against Lele, The Green-Eyed Illusionist!
Axolangelo, The Master of Arts
The Art Gallery is where Axolangelo resides alongside all of his paintings. The name Axolangelo was due to an internal pun/joke within the development team that came from combining the animal axolotl and the famous painter Michelangelo. This is one of the first major challenges and bosses Ace will encounter in the Palace. Players can attempt to take him on in our free demo available now on the Dandy Ace Steam page!
Allies
Dandy Ace was not the only one to be trapped in the Cursed Mirror by Lele. Ace will need the help of his stage assistants and some of the other characters he meets along the way to escape.
Jolly Jolly & Jenny Jenny
Ace’s twin stage assistants will be there to help Ace investigate the power of the shards in the Cursed Mirror realm as well as take care of the many magical cards and trinkets Ace collects.
Nnif
Nnif is a bunny that used to work for Lele but decided to end his services and pursue a rogue life as a smuggler. Nnif is always looking to sell you the latest exclusive power-ups at his Tent in exchange for shards.
The Art of Dandy Ace
 We want to give you a game as spectacular as Dandy Ace himself!This is just a sample of our work, with character designs, concepts, illustrations, and background pictures that you will see in the final product.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've learned a lot from our experience of working on and launching No Heroes Here and hope to improve on that with Dandy Ace. Dandy Ace is a larger project for us and while we are confident that we will be able to launch the game across all platforms next year, there are many features that we'd like to get in for launch that are still incomplete or haven't had development started on them. There are also existing features that need improvement such as the tutorials and overall Narrative experience.

We hope to get as much of it done as possible for the launch or shortly after launch. Some things may change or take longer than expected in the development process but we will be keeping our community and all backers informed about all updates, issues, and changes on a regular basis. Thank you for all your support and faith in our project and team!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Romance your swords! Capture the hearts of weapons to level them up in this “shack-and-slash” dungeon crawling adventure. Forge relationships and save Love itself!
We've decided $200k USD is our final stretch goal. Although we'll continue using your money to improve the game's polish and quality, we don't feel comfortable promising any further features or additional content. So... thank you for making our dream come true! Now it's our turn to repay the favor.
 Boyfriend Dungeon is an action-RPG dungeon crawler in which the weapons you use transform into beautiful people -- take them on dates to level them up and become more powerful together.
Date up to nine weapons, from dancing swords to heart-piercing daggers
Generated action-combat dunj and challenges! Stay sharp!
Various combat styles. For example, hit hard and dodge quickly with the dagger, or take on crowds with Lasersaber
Inclusive, tasteful approach to gender and sexuality, including male, female, and non-binary romance
Let's get to the point: take your weapon-babes on romantic outings, such as to the club or the beach
The couple that slays together, stays together.
 This campaign not only supports us making our dream game, but also offers you once-in-a-lifetime merchandise, including weapon-dating-based mugs, body pillowcases, pins, and other extremely practical objects.
Awards: Boyfriend Dungeon has already won two awards at BitSummit, and has been selected for showcases, including the PAX West Indie Megabooth and the Damage Camp Arcade 2018.  
Platforms: Boyfriend Dungeon is developed by us, Kitfox Games, and we already have permission to create the game on Steam for PC, Mac, and Linux! Check out our Steam coming soon page and after you back us, feel free to add us to your wishlist…
We will also offer DRM-free versions of PC, Mac, and Linux via the Humble Store.
What about consoles? Or other stores? We’re not ready to talk about consoles yet, sorry! This campaign is specifically to support us being able to make the best possible desktop version and merchandise.
Kitfox Games is an award-winning game studio. Boyfriend Dungeon is the fourth title we're bringing to Steam. For more information about our past games, scroll down to the section below entitled The Team.
As of the start of this campaign, we've now revealed all 5 of the weapons you can date (Talwar, Dagger, Epee, Lasersaber, and Glaive).
This campaign, in addition to helping us finish the game, will fund a 6th weapon... the cat, Brass Knuckles!
We don’t want to give away too many spoilers, so we won’t tell you everything about the weapons, but we’ve prepared these dating profiles so you can get an idea of who you might prefer! If you're more interested in their combat abilities and play-styles, scroll down to see their individual tactics.
Alternately, you can take our Wielder Test to see which one we would recommend for you.
The talwar is a type of curved sword or sabre from the Indian Subcontinent. (Wikipedia)
Sunder says: "Hey, gorgeous. I didn't expect to meet someone like you in the dunj... I hope I can keep you safe. I've been around a while but don't believe everything you hear -- some people are jealous, or don't know how to forgive. But you're the open-minded type, right?"
Daggers have been used throughout human experience for close combat confrontations... (Wikipedia)
Valeria says: "Oh, hey, you're cute! So.. what's your deal? You can tell me. If you want to, I mean. What? Oh, don't worry about him. He's just an old friend, looking out for me. Let's talk about you instead. Maybe you should come by my studio sometime and I'll paint you.."
The entire body is the valid target area. A successful épée fencer must be able to anticipate their opponent's moves and strike their opponent at the correct time. (Wikipedia)
Isaac says: "Goodness. Let's get down to facts, shall we? I may be new to the dunj, but I know plenty about fencing. Hold onto me tightly, but not too tight. Deep breaths. Parry, then thrust. Practice makes perfect."
When a Lasersaber powers up, he can be dangerous, but most of the time, he prefers to recharge his batteries.
Seven says: "Hey. I want to keep our.. friendship.. secret for now, if that's okay with you. My agent and fans are a little high-maintenance and I just want to relax. Maybe we can watch TV together sometime?"
This class of polearms [is rated] above all other individual hand-to-hand combat weapons. (Wikipedia)
Sawyer says: "UHH! I'm late for class, but.. hi! Um. Since you seem to have your life together, maybe you can show me how to cook? Would that be okay? I wouldn't want to waste your time. Let me know, but no worries if you're too busy."
And this Kickstarter, if it succeeds, will help fund a sixth weapon, Brass Knuckles! 
Brass knuckles are designed to preserve and concentrate a punch's force... (Wikipedia)
Pocket says: "Meow! Mew meow meow. PRR!" Then he curled up in a ball and fell asleep. When we tried to reach him for further comment, he growled and hissed at us! It seems he's not a lapcat by nature.. and certainly not a romantic partner. Platonic love can be fulfilling, too!
Rowan says: "Hi? This is sudden for me. I'm going to need some time. I'm - never mind. I don't want to bother you. I'll call you, but... please be patient." 
Through your support, we've funded Rowan the Scythe, our second dateable non-binary weapon! They're being designed by Hato Moa, creator of Hatoful Boyfriend.
Leah says: “Hey, cutie. Thanks for including me. I usually like to train alone, but maybe we can try the dunj as a team sport. It’ll be an adventure. Just promise you’ll try your best… and play fair.”
You've manged to fund Leah the Hammer as another stretch goal, our second dateable female weapon!
Axe says: "It's a beautiful day, so... what do you say we leave these computers behind and just go hang out on the beach? Feel free to come surf with me, but... I might not talk much. I hope that's okay. I'd still like your company."  
You funded the Axe! His name will be voted on in our exclusive Discord server (any reward tier at VIP/$35 or above). Invites will be sent out for it soon after the Kickstarter ends, so hold on tight!
You’re free to date only one weapon if you are the monoblade-ous type of person, but nobody minds if you favor grabbing multiple hilts. As you level up your love with them, each Love Rank lets you proceed further with that character’s plot line(s), and also offers combat bonuses.
You’ve been unlucky in love, but you came to Verona Beach to learn from your Cousin Jesse, who’s promised to help you out. Who are you exactly? You choose! You can customize your character, and choose from him, her, or them as pronouns. This doesn’t affect who you can date or what options you have.
Fair Verona Beach, where we lay our scene, is in many ways a typical southern California town. The weather’s great, the surf is high, and the slang 'dunj' is dangerous. In this gig economy, some people turn to killing monsters for a quick buck… while others discover they can transform into weapons.  
Verona Beach is populated by various other people (baristas, security guards, shop keepers, etc). They’re mostly pretty nice, and some of them even care about you!  
But something darker lurks in Verona Beach…
Unfortunately, kissing can’t solve all of your problems. Sometimes, you need a sword. Wait, stop kissing the sword. Wield it instead!
These days, kids get money and meet people by killing monsters in the dunj, making the world a safer place in the process. Be brave -- local authorities are willing to give you basic medical attention afterwards. Clearing local infestations is a group effort!    
The first dunj is the Verona Beach Center, a mall overrun by creatures most hideous. We have two more dunjs in progress, the Nightclub and something secret! Each dunj features different monster types, challenges, music, potential romantic spots to find, and secrets to discover.    
Boss monsters may also interrupt your dunj flow, so train up and make sure you and your weapon are both ready for a tough fight!  
Boss concepts
Sometimes there are enemies that swarm; sometimes you need to focus your attacks; sometimes you need to move around to avoid an onslaught! Some weapons will be better-suited to some dunjs and enemy encounters than others.  
It’s up to you to find the best tactics in each situation… or you could just get more experience and level up until you one-shot them, if you prefer. A general idea of how each weapon plays: 
Left: Talwar | Right: Dagger
Talwar attacks and combos tend to cover a wider area, while Dagger attacks and combos tend to be quick and focus on a narrower area. 
Left: Epee | Right: Lasersaber
Epee attacks and combos tend to require precision but have the capability to stun, while Lasersaber attacks and combos can be upgraded to reflect projectiles and do ranged attacks! 
All of these (plus the development of Glaive and Brass Knuckles) are likely to evolve as we continue to work on the game. We’ve made good progress, but our Kickstarter backers will help us nail down many of the details in the coming months. 
What if it’s too easy or too hard? We’ll have difficulty modes, but we’d also like to offer special challenges and opt-in modifiers for folks that want to, for example, make enemies have more health, or want to fight optional bosses, in exchange for more loot. This means the game will be complete-able at a basic level even by folks who normally stick to dating sims, while also offering some "fun" to those poor masochists who have been damaged by Dark Souls (you know who you are). 
A good relationship with your weapon starts with a romantic date. Luckily for you, Verona Beach is filled with dreamy date spots like the local museum, sunny beach, or flashy nightclub. Make the right choices and you might find your weapons warming up to you!
As you date each weapon, you’ll learn more about them and earn their trust, making you a more effective team in combat. 
But, in this game as in real life, every relationship is a little bit different in its benefits and demands. Some partners will teach you how to do more damage, while others will help you use skills more effectively.
Even when you're busy slaying monsters, the dunj will feature spots for some mini-dates, because love knows no bounds. Above all, you'll be able to cultivate meaningful relationships full of supportive and inviting weapon babes... it just might take a bit of charm to get them out of their sheathes. 
You’re probably wondering what you’re going to get from backing! Well, I mean, other than the eternal love and gratitude of the Kitfox team, of course.
Receive a dev-signed postcard from Verona Beach! Available in the Long Distance Relationship tier and above.
The Kickstarter-exclusive enamel pin, available in the Bae Box Set tier and above.
The Bae Box Set includes an elegant rose USB key, in which to hide your heart's secrets.
  Everything in the Bae Box tier. Includes: the game, soundtrack, rose USB key, enamel pin, and sticker sheet, all in a beautiful box for your shelf.
Temperature changing Boyfriend Dungeonmaster mugs of infinite thirst. Included in the Ultimate Collector's Edition.
Transform Talwar OR Dagger at will from their human form (front) to weapon form (back). One of your choice is included in the Ultimate Collector's Edition.
This super-soft, high-quality cotton blend Sword Smoocher shirt color combo (white on black) is only available via the Ultimate Collector's Edition tier!
Everything in the Ultimate Collector's Edition tier. Includes: T-Shirt, Messenger Bag, Stickers, Soundtrack CD, Mug, Pin, USB Rose game copy, Collector's Edition Box Set, and a Body Pillowcase of your choosing
The music, sound effects and audio design overall will be managed by Omar Dabbous, audio designer of GNOG by KO_OP.  
The soundtrack of Boyfriend Dungeon is an hour of all-original summery weapon-pop from the master composer Marskye (also of GNOG), often featuring the vocals of Madeleine McQueen.    
Their collaboration has already produced a few amazing tracks, including the main theme song you hear in the trailer, “Without a Weapon” (Soundcloud link):   
  And, presented here for the first time, a preview of the new soon-to-be-hit single, Spellbound:
 If you back the project now, you’re sure to get notified when we post more songs and track previews in the future, during and after the campaign.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Background Illustration: Jessica Mao is creating most of the game’s background illustrations! They're an illustrator from Toronto, currently working as a Jr. Art Director for mobile games in the San Francisco Bay Area. Their past work includes animations and illustrations for Titmouse, Studio Yotta, Konami and Penguin Random House. Jessica would transform into a Shield in the dunj.
Animation: Sunder Raj from Particle Beam made the beautiful animation of Talwar's transformation! We'd love to hire Particle Beam to make transformation sequences for the rest of the weapons, but we'll see what we can afford... Sunder from Particle Beam would transform into a Durian in the dunj.
Japanese Localization & Publishing: We loved working with Kakehashi Games to bring the best version of Moon Hunters and The Shrouded Isle to Japan, so we'll be working with them again for Boyfriend Dungeon. The lead of Kakehashi, Zach, would transform into a Kusarigama in the dunj.
Merch Design & Manufacturing: We were really impressed by the Moon Hunters indiebox, so we decided to work with them to create the Boyfriend Dungeon merch, which resulted in the luscious tiers of rewards here. If you're looking to make money from shirts & pins, we recommend Indiebox, so hit up James at ConferenceMerch.com (tell him Tanya sent ya)! The lead of Indiebox, James, would transform into Nunchucks in the dunj.
Hey, we're Kitfox Games! We're an independent Montreal-based games studio with a soft spot for exploring and discovering new, dangerous worlds. Previously, we made Shattered Planet, Moon Hunters, The Shrouded Isle, and in addition to making Boyfriend Dungeon we're publishing Six Ages.
The Boyfriend Dungeon team
Tanya X. Short (@tanyaxshort): Captain, Lead Designer. Led Kitfox in creating Moon Hunters and Shattered Planet, and wrote for and published The Shrouded Isle. Previously was a senior designer on The Secret World and Age of Conan. Tanya has never said she didn't date a weapon, so you could probably say this game is based on a true story. Nobody can prove otherwise. Tanya would transform into a Sabre in the dunj.
Xin Ran Liu (@xinranliu): Art Director. Previously art directed Moon Hunters and Shattered Planet, and illustrated tons of different things, from book covers to band posters to game concept art. Xin would transform into a Chakram in the dunj.  
Marcelo Perez (@scientistsloth): Lead Programmer. Marcelo (almost) single-handedly coded the Moon Hunters cooking system and also ported Moon Hunters to all the consoles! Now that he’s almost recovered from such a feat, he’s making sure Boyfriend Dungeon is better-structured for porting. Marcelo would transform into a Meteor Hammer in the dunj.
Kira Boom (@snowkittykira): Dungeon Programmer. Kira was the primary combat programmer for Moon Hunters, and previously did lots of programming on FRACT OSC. She’s also part of Mindfungus, which released the adorable Cityglitch! Kira is a wielder, not a weapon.
Victoria Tran (@thevtran): Community Manager & Public Relations. Victoria has been managing the Kitfox events, community, press, and social media for over a year now, so if you’ve fallen in love with silly Boyfriend Dungeon gifs, that’s her genius. Victoria would transform into a Bread Knife in the dunj.  
Hey, I Remember Moon Hunters!
Thank you to everyone who backed our first Kickstarter in 2014! Because of their help, and other funding sources, we were able to create our first big game, Moon Hunters! Moon Hunters sold decently well and won some awards, so, it’s hard to complain. Plus we released it with only a few months of delay -- not bad.
We learned a few lessons along the way, which we’re applying to Boyfriend Dungeon, like to carefully structure support for potential future DLC. There was also Shattered Planet and the Shrouded Isle, but we didn’t Kickstart them. I hope you still bought them. We sure learned a lot from those, too.
There are also a few Kitfoxes working on a different game (you might wonder where Jongwoo went, for example), but they are using a different source of funding, and none of the Kickstarter money will go to them. Speaking of which... 
Without your help, we don't know when Boyfriend Dungeon will happen or when we can finish the game as it demands. Plus, with this campaign, we can add the cat as a weapon and make all of the dates, dungeons, and everything in between as polished, beautiful, and amazing as they can be. 
We loved the input we got from Moon Hunters backers, but we felt like we didn't use it enough because we weren't ready for all of your ideas! So we want your feedback to help us shape the game in the years to come.
We’re going to be especially interested in feedback on:  
Balancing and pacing  
Character story arcs & tone/content 
New item/equipment ideas
Although early beta-testers (from CAD$35+) will have the opportunity to give the most hands-on feedback experience with us, we will post regular updates to Kickstarter, and all backers’ comments will be welcomed and shared among the team.  
PLUS we wanted to make some unique limited-edition merch and pre-ordering those mugs and t-shirts and pillow cases makes it easier for us to see how many to make. :)  
Please back us so that we can get your input, and also deliver sweet merch to sweet people.
We’ve already been working on Boyfriend Dungeon for over a year! But this Kickstarter helps us understand how many fans are out there, and how much we can afford to keep pouring our hearts (and wallets) into it.  
This is roughly how we will split up the funds:
And, with your help, we not only reached our goal... we reached all of our stretch goals! So we decided to stop scoping up, past $200k, and make the game the best it can be, with the features and content we are already planning. Thank you so much for believing in us!
Our current language support plans include only English, French, and Japanese, due to the amount of words. We may consider others, depending on community involvement.
As for the development schedule, we’re currently in the midst of production that we hope will finish next year, but we will work with Indiebox to mail your physical rewards as soon as we can, even before the game releases.
Thanks for all of your excitement, enthusiasm, and support. If you can't afford to buy the game, we understand.. but please tell any friends or acquaintances you might have that CAN -- every dollar and/or wishlist helps.

Kitfox Games is an award-winning studio that has released multiple games, including successfully releasing a Kickstarted game previously (Moon Hunters). However, every unfinished game has risks. Boyfriend Dungeon is most of the way through production already, and already has a fully staffed team, so it is considered low-risk as a project.

updates.update_content:
Hey sword smoochers!
*Cracks knuckles* 
This update has quite a few things to go through (October has been a busy month -- we released a murder mystery game!) so let's dive right into it.
Dev Updates

Hey sword smoochers!
So 2020 has been uh, difficult, to put it lightly.
While we’re privileged to be able to work remotely, it’s been a hard time for many of us on the team for various mental and personal reasons. Throughout the year we’ve made adjustments to ensure we’ve been as mentally/physically safe as possible, at least from an employment standpoint. Plus, we’ve always been staunch believers of not crunching to fill a deadline. All of this means that although the work continues steadily, we’re not quite as productive in 2020 as we’d planned, and that doesn’t seem likely to change anytime soon.

Hi sword smoochers!
Whoa, almost missed August. I've been busy prepping for the Pupperazzi and Lucifier Within Us Demo announcements, hence the almost late update on my end. :) But the good news is that doesn't affect Boyfriend Dungeon, so here's what the team has been working on!
Hidden Rooms

campaign.story:
Play Holographic AR Games With Your Mobile Device! The Spatial MRX is a mobile accessory that converts your phone or tablet into a holographic, augmented gaming machine with a built-in camera that integrates physical piece play. 
The MRX comes with an exclusive suite of AR (Augmented Reality) games made by 10 different studios. Multiplayer games use physical pieces to project interactive holograms without using AR/VR headsets. Traditional tabletop gaming meets digital, holographic action with a joypad in one hand and play pieces in the other.  
Play Face-to-Face and Hands-On
Why play holographic AR Games?... We love board games like Settlers of Catan but we also can't get enough of video games like Hearthstone and Clash Royale. The first one brings the authentic joy of tabletop piece play while the digital side is exciting because of it's mechanics and graphics. Spatial's holographic AR merges the best of classic, tabletop piece play with a projected, digital experience you share face-to-face with friends and family.
Holographic AR Games for Spatial MRX
Spatial, multiplayer games are designed around fun mechanics that leverage both piece play and a joypad. All the games are exclusive to the platform and allow you to play hands-on in this unique form of augmented reality.
 It’s time to duel! Mythico mixes the deck building of physical cards with the excitement of holographic projection. Inspired by Yu-gi-oh™ and Magic the Gathering™, you can inject heroes, attack and track stats and levels automatically. It’s 2018 and it’s about time we had holographic collectible card games! Gather around the table for Mythico and battle it out with your monsters you bring to life. 
HoloCraft allows you to play tabletop RPGs as you normally would but now with a projected user interface. Create a world as big as your table and each player has their own perspective of the shared holographic, play space. Dungeon building is as easy as dragging any one of 20K prefab components with your hands. When it’s time to play, each adventurer injects customizable characters they can tie to physical play pieces.  
A squad-based multiplayer, real-time strategy game that turns your table into a kingdom under siege. Strategize how to build and level your army to become king of the land.
Protect the payload as it makes its way through a mutant bug infested battlefield. An engineer and his hammer must win the day in a mix of hi-tech tower defense and hero battler. 
A physics based party game with a magnet that is one part crane and one part catapult. Stack and migrate unstable towers of garbage to the finish line before your opponent blows it up with a toilet bowl.
It's like American Gladiators gone AR where one player builds the map and runs a cannon, while the other players have one minute to bolt through the course and make it to the finish line alive. Run, jump, roll, and summon special tools to survive.
Unlimited Games, Forever
Lock In Every Game We Ever Make - Play any of the available games by downloading them from their respective App Store and enabling them with an Activation Code. As a thanks to our backers we are offering an Unlimited Activation Code Reward so you never have to spend another dollar on content if you chose. 
The Spatial AR Gaming Alliance will be delivering great gaming experiences that we think show off the best of what the platform can do. Backers can have everything ever made for the MRX platform at no extra cost ever (with the Unlimited Access Code reward).
Pipeline of Games from the Spatial AR Gaming Alliance 
10 studios are developing games for the platform with more added every month. More titles and dates will be announced soon.
Magic Window Projection
Holographic Glass - Holographic projection removes the digital screen so you can play hands-on.
The Magic Window is your portal into a shared, holographic play space. Projected characters are tied to play pieces, cards and tokens. Move the MRX around the table and your perspective changes in real time. Add additional MRXs and each person will see another side of the same battle field.
Integrated Camera 
Real-time Play Piece Tracking  - Integrates physical pieces with the projected AR world, merging the best of digital gaming and tabletop play.
The MRX rig comes with an integrated camera that tracks play pieces to present a realistic, interactive model of characters and objects in real-time.
Classic Integrated Joypad
Holograms You Control - A familiar built-in joypad adds run-n-gun style control of holograms spawned from play pieces.
Run, gun and battle across your table controlling holograms in real-time.
Powered by Your Mobile Device
Everything Else is Built-In - The MRX and your mobile device are all that you need for a great, mixed reality game night.  
Simply download a Spatial game on your smartphone or tablet. Dock it in the MRX and enjoy projected AR fun with family and friends.
Initial Supported Devices (More Tested Soon):
iPhone 6 or newer
iPad 2 or newer
Android Phones at Android Version 4.4 or newer. Example: Samsung Galaxy s6 or newer
Android Tablets at Android Version 4.4 or newer. Example: Samsung Tab S2 or newer
* Devices don't need specific AR capabilities as the MRX has the built-in camera.
Compact & Collapsible 
Pack it Up - The MRX is a mobile accessory easy enough to take with you. 
When it’s time to wrap it up you can collapse the MRX and put it on the shelf. Weighing in at 2 lbs, it’s a little bit bigger than a tablet with 4 inches of depth.
What You'll Need / How It Works
What You'll Need
- WIFI network (with Internet to download the game otherwise games run without Internet connection).
- Power Outlet. Each MRX needs to be plugged in.
- A supported mobile device (See Initial Supported Devices above).
Getting Started (Only Needed the First Time You Use It)
- Unfold: Lift the Magic Window and it snaps into the place
- Plug It In: Power plug comes out of the back
- Download a Spatial Game: Go to Google Play or the AppStore
- Pair the Game with the MRX: The game has a feature to discover the MRX as an access point. The app then configures the MRX to have it's own WIFI connection (similar setup to Alexa)
- Dock Your Mobile Device: Place your mobile device in the MRX cradle and your ready to rock.
Steps Each Time You Play
- Unfold
- Dock Your Mobile Device
Multiplayer
- Each game has a lobby where you match up to other players over WIFI. The gaming engine uses real-time replication and makes it so each person has their own perspective of the same digital world.
Innovative Multiplayer Interaction 
The More The Merrier - Each player has his/her own perspective on the same holographic scene.
No need to wait for a turn, join up to 6 players at once (locally or online). Simply add additional MRXs and let them in on the action.
Physical Game Pieces 
Classic & Digital Play Collide -  The disks, tokens and cards from tabletop play spawn digital characters and offer unique hands-on interaction.
The playing of physical pieces in games is a classic method of tabletop gameplay. Now you can enjoy this tactile and obvious form of play in a digital gaming environment without staring directly at a screen.
No Headsets Required
Free from Headsets and Glasses - Enjoy exciting and interactive mixed reality play without the expensive equipment like AR/VR headsets.
The MRX Rig doesn’t require any wearables and works with a projected model with it's Magic Window design.
Partners
 Avnet 
Hardware Studio Connection is a partnership between Avnet and Dragon Innovation to prepare Kickstarter creators (working on hardware products) with guidance, feedback, and services to help build more accurate cost projections, and a realistic manufacturing timeline.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been playing games on the Spatial MRX for 9 months now, and we are really happy with where the platform is currently at. Most of the effort of late has been zooming in on our games and making sure it's the type of content that is engaging and leverages the platform. The physical platform risk is equal to any Internet of Things type device. Believe it or not the electronics are pretty straight forward although it is custom because we wanted to reach as accessible a price as is possible. We are partnered with Avnet and their Hardware Studio program and they’ve been instrumental in coordinating our specific quotes for the electronics. We are choosing between several competing offers for the full assembly of the products. We will be able to dial in the specific units once the campaign is done. Some people may think we are doing a loss-lead (selling at a loss) type play and that is not true. The product has standard retail margins despite some of the tech that is inside and this is true even of our first production run (based on our unit estimates). In some senses the inside of the MRX has the architecture of a displayless, IoT camera device where almost all the data is sent over WIFI to the mobile app. It is safe to say we have considered cost in every step and decision we made. The other form of risk is based on the games. The SDK we have built makes building a game on Spatial a really straight forward experience. Developers are essentially doing the same thing they normally do but on a ground plane that is the table and with a 3rd party game camera. Our founders have created successful software/hardware companies 4 times over prior to this project (all our own inventions) and we are very familiar with the challenges ahead.

updates.update_content: Hi all. Our previously mentioned deal has been seriously delayed so we don't have a final product to launch. We will be issuing refunds to everyone and ending the campaign. We want to do the best thing we can in order to make up for these horrible delays. The product we are making for the pending deal is materially different than our initial vision and even if people were willing to wait it just doesn't make sense dragging it out via orders taken over a year ago. We think the final product will still be great but to be frank, this product can only work through a retail channel. Retail channels are going through extremely tough times across the food chain and that has made them very risk averse, especially when it comes to digital / physical products. That pressure drove the product changes and that has pushed out the release timing.

updates.update_userinfo: Sorry for the long delay in updating...
updates.update_content:
We will have a material update on everything within 2 weeks. In the mean time, for those who requested refunds, we will complete processing them by the end of next week. We will be issuing the refunds via Kickstarter, so if your KS banking info has changed, please update it accordingly.
Thanks,
The Spatial Team

Hi All. Several updates for you. We'll talk ship dates at the bottom but we want to update you on us in total as it influences everything else.
We have several deals for distribution on the table. They are with players you would recognize and upon completion will cement our market direction as well as make for a vibrant, healthy company that can deliver fun for the long haul.
That direction is the same as we have laid out but yet to some it may seem different so let us try to explain. We have always been about physically close, social, augmented reality gaming. The distributors really like our current direction of being able to play games at tabletop scale and now at full room or multi-room scale. In addition you can now play games in 3rd person or 1st person. This will all make more sense when you see the video link below. Please keep in mind that you can scale any experience to any physical space so although you don't see us playing on a table you certainly can, but the bigger scale stuff is a huge draw.

Hi All, June 17th will be the ship date for Founder's Club units. The other 700 systems will go out over the following 2 months as we will get them in several batches. The shipments will go in time order from when the pledge was made. We are creating a spreadsheet so you know where you land. Please hold on messaging us regarding which bucket/shipment you'll be in, we will message you and also to confirm mailing address' etc. I'm sorry we didn't make good on the original dates. I hope to not be perpetually apologizing but I hope that you know we are doing our best work in making something you will love.

Hi All, Happy new years to you and yours!
Team Spatial worked straight through the holidays advancing the ball down the field. Here are the updates.
The past 2.5 months has generated a lot of impossibly, relevant business development meetings where we have learned a ton about what our product needs to look like in order to be successful. We have been making these changes to insure there is a business that can thrive after the initial product delivery to you fine folks. The major part has been a focus on form factor, bulkiness, ability to easily make games and an ability to have more degrees of freedom to move around an augmented play field. To be perfectly frank it was a shot in the gut that the thing we thought was perfect as pitched in the campaign has some work still left to do. We’ve found quite often that the most raw feedback only comes when you start asking distribution partners for orders! In the next 2-3 weeks we will be able to demonstrate these changes in the platform.

updates.update_userinfo: Having great meetings with the Founder's club folks...
updates.update_content:
Hi Gang, our heads are up now (sorry we've been quiet). We went heads down to do a few things:
1) We've met with a bunch of the partners that became interested in the platform. We've met with leading toy companies and IP brands that you would surely know. We're not trying to tease but we can't post anything specific about it just yet. In a sentence that part couldn't be going better.

We feel like Thank You isn't enough... You have validated our product and given us an opportunity to bring our product to life. There is no shortage of ideas but you never know what will actually get people excited and this process has really clarified a lot of questions for us. By voting with your hard earned dollars you have given us a chance to validate the biggest question of all, "Does the world want accessible, holographic gaming?". This type of question is critical to the success of our company and you are now part of our evolution and for that we Thank You!

In the near future, humans and sentient AI robots rely on each other for survival despite growing tensions and unease. Our protagonist, formerly a veteran police detective but now retired following years of frustration and disillusionment, spends his days intoxicated while accepting random jobs as a private investigator to make ends meet. He exists within the neon sea of an immense city, its blinding artificial lights unable to hide the shadow of greed and lust that threatens to engulf it at any moment.
This drunken cycle is broken when our hero becomes entangled in a missing person's case, one which holds the key to tracking down a monstrous killer who long ago escaped justice. Unlock your memories, decode the truth, and resist drowning in the wave of conspiracy that grips the city!
Stunningly detailed retro-styled pixel-art coupled with modern atmospheric lighting and visual effects bring this unique cyberpunk world to life, while evocative music and sound design build suspense and mystery every step of the way.
 As an adventure game built on mystery and intrigue, the player will encounter various puzzles interspersed throughout the story. These have been designed to test observation and reasoning skills, while also being logical and fun. The puzzles appear organically and help to flesh out the world while also keeping gameplay fresh and interesting.
The story itself has been written and designed to ensure that players care about the characters and the world they exist in. Through this cinematic storytelling comes the motivation to move forward and the constant desire to reach the next twist or plot point.
Similar to other side-scrollers, players can use a control pad or mouse & keyboard to determine movement, dialogue, and interaction between characters in each scene.
Gameplay  
Our protagonist is a very talented detective. He uses powers of observation, reasoning, and deduction to solve puzzles and reveal the mysteries of cases one after another by exploring the scene, analyzing objects, and interrogating witnesses.
In addition, at various points in the game you can take control of his special “assistant” - William the black cat. William can travel deeper into areas our detective can’t reach, often proving decisive in identifying and retrieving key evidence!
Master Detective  
The player needs to search for hidden clues and physical evidence from the perspective of a detective, obtain secrets from the mouths of key individuals, make inferences, and draw conclusions about who is the criminal, their motives and techniques.
Investigation
Item
Maze Explorer  
Many scenes within the game are constructed like a maze, requiring the player to make use of everything around them to escape and move on to the next section.
The goal is to create interesting and logical side-scrolling labyrinths.
Below is an early design example (we don’t want to spoil sections of the finished game!)
 There will also be some independent puzzles in the game interspersed with each stage, so in this way the puzzles can be more diverse.
The game is now more than 50% complete. Several test versions already exist and have been trialed by a small sample group of players for feedback.
The overall framework and flow of the game stages has been finalized.
The main game systems have been completed.  
The artistic style of the game has been fine-tuned, and the main scene assets have also been completed.  
The second offline test has been completed.
We have already exhibited our game at PAX East and have received coverage from Rock Paper Shotgun, and VentureBeat. Thanks to the support of players like you, the main systems and the design of the mechanics are finished. What remains is to finalize the content and refine the experience.
PAX East

Through crowdfunding we hope to acquire a budget to help with improving the performance of the game and completing the later development stages on time. This will also us to complete post-production of music sound effects, and produce physical souvenirs for supporters. This will also allow us to begin work on multi-platform versions of the game. 
Additionally, we hope that through crowdfunding more players will learn about us and our games, and with your support and recognition we can make Tales of the Neon Sea as good as it can be!
Currently, we are working on:  
- Configuration of the stages in the game  
- Development of secondary systems  
- Completion of remaining scene resources  
- The production of special actions of the protagonist  
- Production of music and sound effects - Game debugging
 An independent game development team consisting of 11 members, we have produced 8 games since 2013. "Fairy in Wonderland" and "Xnooker" were recommended on the App Store, and this positive response from Apple gave us the belief to continue down the road of indie development.
 All of our previous games were mobile titles, however after careful thought and consideration we have decided to follow our passion and transition to PC and console development. Using all the experience we gained up to this point, we are now ready to make the jump to a larger and more involving experience – one that is close to our hearts. This is Tales of the Neon Sea!
During the last number of months, we have collected a lot of valuable comments and feedback from many players - and we have received a lot of love and support. Following much research and preparation, we believe Kickstarter is the right move to help boost our project over the finish line. Thank you to everyone who chooses to be a part of this project, we are working as hard as possible to create a unique and special experience.

Happy New Year to all our backers and fans! We hope everyone enjoyed the holiday period and are ready for an awesome 2019!
Refrigerator Magnet Update! 
We’ve begun sending the magnets out to backers, and we hope they arrive as soon as possible. As we have received a lot of feedback from fans asking how they can get ahold of their own Tales of the Neon Sea fridge magnets, we will soon be placing these for sale online. However, we want to ensure that those who pledged for a more expensive option in order to receive fridge magnets are treated fairly, and as such the price of these items in the online store will be set to reflect that. We’ve also designed a mouse pad featuring the detailed pixel art from the game, and this will be going on sale too.

Greetings everyone!
Work on Tales of the Neon Sea continues at full speed, and everyday we move closer to a finished version. However it’s becoming clear that we won’t reach the finish line before the end of 2018. Rather than put quality at risk, we’re now aiming for an early 2019 release. Sorry for the extended wait, and thanks once again for all of your patience and support!
In the meantime (and not related to the game release delay!) we have completed some of our fridge magnets samples. Check it out!

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Sorry to keep you waiting, as you can imagine we have been working full steam ahead on Tales of the Neon Sea and this has left us with little free time.
Development is continuing smoothly, and thanks to your support we are able to improve content and fine tune the experience! We’ve also gotten hold of Sony and Nintendo dev kits, and looking forward to porting to those machines.

Our Tales of the Neon Sea Kickstarter is now done and dusted, with 845 backers helping us to far surpass our original goal! Thanks to everyone who contributed. You guys are awesome, and now it’s up to us to deliver the best experience possible.
We’ll continue to update our status as we pass various milestones, starting with some pictures of our PAX West 2018 Indie MEGABOOTH presence!

Thank you all so much, your generosity has brought our dream to life! We are very grateful to everyone who backed us, or simply helped to spread the word of our little cyberpunk tale.
We will continue to update our status and work to finish Tales of the Neon Sea as soon as possible.
Right now we are showcasing the game at Gamescom in Cologne, and after that PAX West in Seattle. Your enthusiasm fuels our passion!

campaign.story:
PLAY

Scroll down for more in-depth gameplay.
Over a year ago, Robert Bowling put me in touch with Studio71, who approached me about doing a possible Binding of Isaac themed board game. I kinda blew them off saying I didn't have any ideas for something like that and I was far too busy with The End is Nigh and Bum-Bo to start thinking about it (but the seed had been planted).
Fast forward 9 or 10 months.
I was sick with the flu, stuck on the living room couch, bored out of my mind when the basic structure for a Binding Of Isaac card game started taking over my brain. Within 5 days I had roughly 200 cards, drew them up and started testing things with Danielle. 
Even at this phase the game was fun, every play session felt totally new, dynamic and interesting.
Within a month U had a fully fleshed out a prototype using sleeved cards with sticker paper, I scribbled down and reverse engineered the mechanics for as many iconic monsters, items, characters and random happenings from the digital game as I could.  
It was really fun to take a well known item or monster from the game and think up ways to convey stuff like, How could I show that the carrion queen takes damage when you hit her butt? Or how could I represent the rng aspects of cursed floors or troll bombs only using a deck of cards? 
Once we finished the first 4 player game session, I knew this was something super unique that really embodied everything people love about The Binding of Isaac. 
People joined forces to take down giant bosses, bartered their way to more items and stabbed each other in the back once someone started inching closer to having 4 souls. 
I called up Studio71 and told them I was ready.
The prototype has gone through many different major revisions over the months and i’m sure things will change as the Kickstarter unfolds but it’s in a place where I’m extremely happy with how well it plays and everyone I've tested with always wants another round so that's a good sign.
                                                                                                                                                The basics:
2-4 players take turns playing loot cards and using items to kill monsters that yield more items, loot, and sometimes souls. The first player to end their turn with 4 souls is the winner. Cooperation, barter, and betrayal is encouraged.
Starting the game:
Shuffle the monster, loot, and treasure decks and place them on the table.
Take the top 2 cards from the monster deck and place them face up on the table. These are the current active monsters.
Take the top 2 cards from the treasure deck and place them face up on the table. These are the current store items.
Each player starts the game with 3 loot cards and 3¢.
Cain always goes first, if Cain is not one of the characters drawn, then the saddest player goes first.
Player turn:
1) Charge all activated items (Turn all used items upright) 
2) Draw 1 loot card
3) Main phase
During their main phase the active player may do any or all of these things in any order: 
1. Play 1 loot card, this can be in response to any action.
2. Purchase 1 store item or purchase the unknown top card of the treasure deck. (All store items cost 10¢, including the top card of the deck)
3. Attack a monster. (The player can choose to attack any active monster or attack the unknown top card of the monster deck)
4. Activate their player card to play an additional loot card. (Player cards can also be saved and activated on other player’s turns in response to any action)
4) Ending phase 
1. Check to see if any player has 4+ souls. if they do, they win and the game ends. 
2. Heal damage done to all players and monsters. 
3. Pass the turn to the player to your left.
Loot cards:
Keep loot cards in your hand without revealing them to other players. You may play one loot card during each of your turn.
Trinkets: These rare loot cards play like treasure items and have passive effects. Place these cards face up on the table next to your item cards, they count as items when in play.
Basic loot: Basic loot comes in the form of coins, bombs, hearts, pills and the like and are used to gain resources or help in combat.
Tarot cards: Tarot cards are more advanced loot cards that can drastically change the course of the game.
Special loot: These are secret! shhhhhhhh...
The Monster deck is the meat and potatoes of the game. It’s filled with basic monsters, bosses, treasures, curses and other surprises.
Basic monster: Monsters that are easier to kill and yield loot, coins, and on rare occasion, treasure.
Bosses: Harder monsters with bigger rewards that all yield souls when killed (Souls are how you win, remember?)
Chests/Bonus cards: Rare cards that yield rewards with little effort and change the game... but they may also kill you…
Curses: Rare cards that, when revealed, curse the player in the lead. Curse cards are placed to the left of your character card. Curses are discarded when the cursed player dies.
Treasure cards:
Active items: These items can be activated at any time to use their abilities and are noted with a turning arrow symbol. You show an item is activated by turning it sideways. (These items can be activated in response to any action) Once an item has been activated, it can't be activated again until it’s charged at the start of that player's turn.
Paid items: These items activate when you pay a specific cost (ie, discard a card, pay 2¢ or take 2 damage). Paid items can be used in response to any action and can be used as many times as they can be paid for.
Passive items: These items give players special abilities that usually change the rules of the game or modify existing effects. These abilities don't require activation.
Combat:
Each player may attack the monster deck once during their turn. If the player chooses to attack, they may choose to attack an active monster card (face up monster card next to the deck) or the top card of the monster deck. If they attack the top of the deck, reveal that monster card to all players and place it over one of the active monster cards face up.
When a player attacks a monster card, they roll their d6. If the number is greater than or equal to that creature’s DICE number, then they deal damage equal to their damage number to that creature. (That is, unless someone uses an ability to modify or reroll the result!) If the attacking player rolls lower than the creature’s dice number, that player takes damage equal to that monster’s damage number. The attacking player continues to roll their d6 until that creature takes lethal damage(damage greater than or equal to that creature’s hit points) or that creature deals lethal damage to the player.
If a monster is killed, the active player gains any rewards for killing it and the card is placed on the top of the monster discard pile face up. If an active monster is killed and there are no cards underneath it, reveal the top card of the monster deck and place it face up in the active monster card zone, replacing the killed monster.
If a monster deals lethal damage to a player, that player is killed. (see Death:) That player pays a penalty and ends their turn.
All damage done to players and monsters is healed at the end of any player’s turn.
If a non-monster card is revealed when a player attacks the top card of the library or is revealed after killing an active monster, the active player reads that card to all players and follows the directions on the card. You can no longer attack the monster deck this turn.
Death:
When a player takes lethal damage or is killed for any reason, that player suffers a death penalty.
If that player has any items beyond their starting item, they choose and destroy one of them, placing it in that cards discard pile.
In addition to an item, that player also discards a card, loses 1¢ and deactivates all their items and player card.
After paying the death penalty, if the player was killed during their turn, their turn ends.
Advanced play aka the bonus souls: Once players have a better understanding of the games mechanics, you are encouraged to add the bonus souls, the Soul of Greed and the Soul of Gluttony, to your games.
These bonus cards aren’t added to any deck but instead exist face up on the table next to the game decks in view of all players.
If any player completes their turn with 25¢ or more, they acquire the Soul of Greed. If any player completes their turn with 10 or more loot cards in their hand, they acquire the Soul of Gluttony.
Once acquired, these souls can’t be gained again for the rest of that game.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Development like a dungeon can be filled with peril and winding roads but here is how we are preparing for the journey:

Schedule: Delays and push backs may occur depending on the development roadblocks we face. Some features and content updates may take longer than expected to put in and there is a chance the full release date my push if things go wrong. The good news is that the early access version will be coming first so backers get to play a good portion of the game straight away while you wait for the nightmarish difficulty to come.
Financial: Kickstarters usually come with a fair amount of financial risk, thankfully we have lessened that risk massively that’s to the sacrifices from the development team and great work done securing investment. This means that the financial risk to you is reduced as the base game is already funded. We as a team did not want to ask for support without a guarantee in place that you will get the game, we didn’t want the project’s completion to be a variable, and now it is not.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
66 thousand visitors, over a million online watchers and hundreds of companies participated in the biggest video game expo in the world – E3 2019. And among the leaders in game development, there to show off their offering was the German company Deadalic Entertainment. Among their games was one developed by the Russian studio Unfrozen. The tactical roguelike-RPG - Iratus: Lord of the Dead.
During the press release, our Editor-in-Chief (Feodor Korochkin) and Lead Writer (Alexander Gonchar) demoed the game to dozens of journalists and streamers from the US, Russia, China, Italy, Germany and other countries. The version we sent to E3 included a fully finished first floor, 16 minions and all the gameplay mechanics; everything that our players will be able to enjoy once we hit early access!

Cosmic Horror and Sci-Fi are two ways to talk about Dolmen. It is a third person action game with RPG elements but with a lovecraftian plot that calls players to find what’s behind the darkest secret of the universe!
A forgotten planet called Revion Prime will be the place where the action takes part. And it won’t be easy: Adaptation and exploration will be your main weapons as you craft new items and equipments from your enemies’ carcasses! Every step can be your last one!
Use your experience points to improve yourself and face what no human has ever faced. After all, quoting David Hume: “The life of man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.” Maybe he was right… Or not.
94% VOTING APPROVAL
We are a young studio based in Natal-RN, Brazil. We have collaborators in Campinas, in other cities here in Brazil and abroad. Our professionals have in common the love for games and the dedication to the challenge of making the best game as possible! Therefore, our motto is work, work and work!
The demo will be available to all backers, after all, you're going to be all visitors of outerspace! You will get a key by Kickstarter messages, so pay attention to your e-mails. Estimated time to receive the key is 2 hours but it can take up to 48 hours depending on the number of backers on the same period.
Once you get the key, you must activate it in the Steam client by clicking in "Add Game..." and then "Active a Product on Steam", then just paste your key and follow on-screen instructions.
You are allowed to take screenshots, record or stream play as you please. 
If you encounter any bugs while playing please report them by sending us an email to kickstarter@massiveworkstudio.com or by joining our Discord Server and posting it in the #bug-track channel: Invite
You can also contact us by email or Discord if you have any questions about this Kickstarter campaign.
On this campaign, as you can see, we ask 90K to keep our process. But we have more. We possess ideas, concepts and plans to finish Dolmen as we intend to have your support to conclude its first and second level. 
Creating a game like that is challenging, so we decided to launch this campaign based on the beginning, since our developers are negotiating with publishers that showed interest on our work. 
Revion Prime is big and it demands the best of us. We hope you are interested too and support our project as well.
What’s left to someone put in such a situation? Well, if you’ll have to face the unpredictable, you’ll have to improvise! 
Intense Melee Combat
Experience rich combat with various types of melee weapons and moves! Attack, block and dodge, as you try to escape from the enemies as well as damage them.
Smart Ranged Combat
Use ranged weapon's elemental shots to cause different debuffs on enemies! All creatures answer specifically to each combination, making the battles always innovative and demanding, so you have to be always attentive!
Energy Management
To activate your ranged weapons, some energy must be spent. But this isn’t the only use of Energy. By activating the Energy Mode, your melee weapon will be empowered too! Also, you can use a portion of Energy to recover a small portion of your HP quickly. But beware, energy does not regenerate by itself, so use it carefully!
 Challenging Enemies
Surviving is the last thing the cosmos wants you to do... Along your way, many creatures will try to end your journey to continue their own!
Gruesome Bosses
The human race deserves to subsist? Many alpha predators will say no!
All environment will provide a feeling of being apart from Earth, which means that a whole new kind of views are waiting for you. 
Fungi, corpses and amorphous stalactites compound the way. Different kinds of vegetal life infest the ecosystem of Revion Prime. 
Every level shows different ways to understand the place: Its plants, fog and terrain will be constantly changing and more and more daring… A whole world can be yours. But you’ll never be yourself again…
 Explore a Ruined World and Find its Secrets
Behold this unforgiving planet called Revion Prime, the last maze to reach the Dolmen! 
Navigate through perilous paths and face obscure traps, like exploding plants and binding webs!
Find materials and adapt them to your needs!
Craft equipments (weapons and armor) and upgrade them to become part of an alien society or what’s left of it… 
You must scour this alien planet, harvest Materials, from dead bodies and create the ultimate survivor gear! 
Look for the answer or make your own! 
Melee Weapons
Ranged Weapons
Mechanical Armor
Organic Armor
Your character has an array of attributes that can be leveled up by using XP, gained from defeating the strangest life forms! 
You can level up your character however you want to suit your specific play style.
Collaborate with other Players to survive in this extraterrestrial ambiance. 
Be challenged and compete with other Players, adding another layer of difficulty and interaction in the game. 
Keep in mind that all multiplayer functionality is not included in the base game. Please help us reach the Stretch Goals so we can add Multiplayer support to the experience! It would be awesome!
Co-Op
You can get help to dominate Revion Prime and to fend off those that invade your timeline. 
PvP
Invade others player’s timelines and take what must be yours!
Area with Online Exclusive Content
There will also be areas with exclusive content for the multiplayer, with tasks to complete in a group.
Pictures shown are for illustration purpose
Learn the language of the universe as you struggle to stay alive!
The plot may be comprehended as an investigation focusing the past and future of an alien planet as seen through the eyes of a human being. Although his original task was very different from that, he was brought to a reality never seen before, with no resources and unprepared for what he will find there.
Uncover the truth by finding and connecting each piece of the lost alphabet of this galaxy!
The music was thought as a mix between sci fi atmosphere and the epic cinematic mood we want to provide. Here, the Classic and the Electronic are walking side by side: As we listen to the sounds of breathing of our character, we can hear a strange machine working and more! A choir coming from the abyss, echoes and drums! Powerful voices and the murmur of the universe...  
This hybrid creation tries to bring the tension of fighting against the unknown. The feeling to be far from home. And to be honest, it’s so emotionally moving that we sometimes listen to every track before start working!  
Thanks to our Composer Antônio Teoli, we know how an alien planet sounds like!
Complete the Missions to unlock the Achievements. You can do that by interacting, liking, sharing and following our social networks:
             Backer Missions
You can also help us in other ways them backing us! How? By completing the following missions all community will earn points, those points will unlock achievements that will be available to everyone, it's a WIN-WIN scenario, guys! Doing this, you'll help us by sharing social media! And we will create more content and interactions for everyone, what do you think?

That's why our team has so much more content for you, more levels, stories, creatures and (some big) weapons! And not only that, but more platforms to support and gameplay modes (HERE'S A SPOILER: Multiplayer!).
But to reach this amount of content, we need you to help us to go beyond the base goal! We need you visiting Revion Prime with us! See what's in store for you below, the goals will unlock as the campaign progresses, ok?

As an orchestra, every instrument has its place and time inside a group! In our studio, it wouldn’t be different. Our team is filled with recognized professionals and brave space explorers that are used to work as a collective mind, gathering their specific areas in one shared goal! What would it be? Well, your fun, of course! To make good games you have to love them! And if we hadn’t love and fun, we wouldn’t be here right now! That’s our recipe to a great team!
A great deal of professionals no longer work with us, and not all of the current team is represented in the picture below. Even so, they all left and leaves their mark on Dolmen!

Platforms
Initially the Dolmen Demo will be released for PC/Windows. When the final game releases it will support also PS4 and Xbox One.
Now, for other platforms, it all depends on the desire of the community.  Give us feedbacks and send requests, if the demand is big we will consider it.
Languages 
Initially the Dolmen Demo will be released with audio and text support for English and text support for Brazilian Portuguese.
When the final game releases it will support all major languages, including but not limited to: Spanish, French, German, Italian, Russian, Japanese, Chinese, and more.  
We will soon launch a survey to gather the community desires about platforms and languages to better comprehend and serve your needs.
Here's how we intend to spend your hard earned money to make Dolmen come true and give you a great gaming experience:
So far we invested over $400k in this project. But Dolmen is a big and ambitious game, for we an average of 30 people working full time on the game.
The value we ask is for the base game. With your support and reaching higher stretch goals we can deliver a more robust experience, with more levels, more supported platforms and online multiplayer!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being here wasn't easy and we are aware that new ideas tend to ask new efforts. This is the point of working so much to ask your support here: The development of any big project demands sacrifices and a lot of adaptability. 

We had to learn it along this process. Sometimes, we failed. Sometimes we succeeded. Both experiences taught us to don’t turn our back on our responsibilities. This process is not only about us, but it’s about you too. We are sharing a vision. We are sharing a world.

That’s why, as a studio, we feel this is the right place to say: Our goal is to do our very best to complete the game as outlined by our funding and stretch goals. If the schedule needed to change, our backers will be the first to know and we’ll be as transparent as possible. We’re in this together and there’s nothing wrong to taking risks if every one of us know how to fight against it. Because that’s what make us professionals.

Any doubt, you can contact us at kickstarter@massiveworkstudio.com and our developers can answer you directly. Any question is welcome.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
